Reviews.Title: “Great Service, fair accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: I was a recent guest at this property. The employees were as nice and as helpful as at any hotel that I have EVER stayed at. However, not sure the accomodations were worth the bang for the buck. There are no ice machines, you have to call for ice, and there is not much in the way of restaurants in the location, you have to go St. Helena to find nice restaurants, about 15 minutes away. Beautiful area and the spa at the property is very nice, not sure you get your bang for your buck, but a nice property right in the middle of Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Comparing Napa Villa-style accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NSIInnerloop2
Reviews.Content: I'm a local to the Bay Area, and we enjoy heading up to Napa for short trips at high end places like Solage. So I feel I can give a good, balanced comparison of some options you may be cross-shopping up here for your trip. There are three resorts we have visited that all seem to target a similar market/demographic. Solage is the newest of these three, and is targeting a price-range between, say, $500-$1000 per night in individual free-standing "studios", with lots of nice facilities and luxury. The closest comparison is probably The Carneros Inn on the extreme opposite end of the Valley. Of the two, I think Solage is the winner. Its smaller and more intimate, and I think has the better location. Price-wise I think they tend to come out about the same. Both are clearly following the same template - modern-style construction, individual rooms, nice pool area, spa, restaurant, good service. I think Solage has the nicer spa, a few more nice service features, and a nicer little corner of the valley it occupies. From the same operator and slightly higher-cost is Calistoga Ranch. Its a true "sister property" located a short hop away on the same road, but the focus at Calistoga Ranch is definitely more about privacy and pleasant surroundings, and less about the restaurant, spa, or pool facilities (although it has all those things). Calistoga Ranch is a bit older property, and a bit costlier generally. For me, Calistoga Ranch is a very unique and relaxing place. The room designs are very unique with two portions of the room separated by an outdoor space, private hot-tubs, etc. And the sloped property with old growth trees, really feels like you've escaped everything. And its a smaller property which means more individual service, and more attention from the concierge. But back to Solage. Having had previous experience with Auberge properties I expected pre-visit service in the form of emails with the concierge, spa, etc. This did happen, but I waiting a bit too long (day before) to make some requests, and the concierge was not able to make everything happen as smoothly as he could have if I had perhaps given more advance notice. I can't fault him here. He WAS able to get us dinner reservations at Solbar when it was fully booked, but not at our first choice of time. The property itself was nice, very reminiscent of Carneros Inn in terms of architecture. Lots of white wood, modern lines, greenery. As with Carneros it still has a bit of a "tract housing" feel for me that doesn't project warmth, but its perfectly nice. They have a rather odd solution to the "you can near your room" issue when checking in. One of the desk staff bikes to your room and you follow in your car. Felt weird, but I can't really suggest a better way. Carneros has the same issue and just simply didn't bother. I think Solage is trying hard to meet that 5-star service level. Whenever you pass by staff on the property they say hello and greet you nicely (a very Four Seasons thing). However, I think they felt short a bit when the desk person who showed us to our room asked "Do you want me to show you to your room" or "can I help you with your bags". Its nit-picky, but I think to really hit the service level expected here they should just go ahead and do all these things and leave it to me to say no, rather than offering this as a "yes/no", because I think the subtext is always "please say no". Something for the next round of training! We booked a Suite here because it offered a private hot-tub, and I was hoping for a fair comparison to our stay at Calistoga Ranch which has a preponderance of private-spa-equipped rooms. Also we find we get good value from this in our room. The spa and suite did not disappoint. Unexpectedly instead of a typical plastic & wood "Hot tub" it was a full-blown in-ground spa like you'd expect in the main pool area; very nice, high marks. We used it 3-4 times in a one night stay it was so hot, clean, and relaxing. We were also pleased to find now one but TWO bottles of wine waiting on ice for us in the room, despite not ordering anything. One sparkling and one white, neither anything special but a nice touch and much preferred to a fruit place, especially in Napa. A good combination with the hot tub. Other high notes - a chance to meet & chat with their Sommelier at 3pm on Saturdays (do it, very fun) and the cocktail menu & bartenders at Sol Bar. We ate at Sol Bar and the food was good, not epic. Service was good as well. I wouldn't say the restaurant was such a highlight that I would make a trip just for that. I DO wish I had spent more time trying different cocktails at the bar and the bar food menu looked REALLY exciting, I wish I had tried more of it. The bar & restaurant and both very nice, airy, and open and a pleasant place to hang out. Even if you're not staying here, I think its worth a visit if you're at the north end of the valley. The Spa was nice, definitely a step above most resort spas in this area. Huge hot mineral water pool, great cabanas (limited number!). Any guest can use the spa facilities including the hot springs pool, which is comparable in size and much nicer than the "official" pool outside Sol Bar. There's a kids pool as well, which ironically is much smaller than, but much more heavily used than, the main pool. But either way, all the pools are nice, big, and well maintained. The scenery here is good, not epic. Its in a nice narrow part of the valley so you have mountain views in any direction, but the resort itself doesn't have any elevation, so you don't get those great wide vistas you might get further up the slopes at like Calisoga Ranch or Auberge de Soleil. So bottom line - which to choose next time? If you are looking to relax and be a bit anti-social, there is nothing like Calisotga Ranch. It feels very luxe, private, and relaxing. If you want a bit more activity, I would go with Solage over Carneros Inn. The service level feels a notch higher, the property is smaller and more private, and the facilities are all top-notch. They also retained a lot of the amenities from Calistoga Ranch like free use of Mercedes Cars, the bikes, and generally excellent concierge service. I still want to check out Meadowood and Auberge (the original property from this operator).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CA_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: We have been here a few times while attending a conference for my husband's company. The location is nicely set back on Silverado Trail but in very close proximity to the main street in Calistoga. Each room comes with 2 beach cruisers that you can ride into town or to some of the nearby wineries. If you're interested in biking to Calistoga wineries off the beaten track don't miss Tedeschi Family Winery. The rooms are very modern, very comfortable and very private. Each room appears to have a nice covered veranda area off the bedroom with comfortable outdoor seating. Housekeeping comes through at least twice a day and keeps everything very clean and fully stocked. They do a nice job of keeping it upscale while focusing on recycling and "green" practices (i.e., rather than lots of throw away shampoo and lotion bottles, everything is in larger refillable pump bottles). The grounds of the hotel and the pool areas are lovely. There is a lively bar with an adjacent bocce ball court that make for a fun happy hour or night cap. The food in the restaurant has always been very good when we've eaten there. My father lives in nearby St. Helena and goes to Solage for the food as well. I would definitely recommend this place to couples or friends looking for a relaxing fun wine country get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort!”
Reviews.Author: CPTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most enjoyable stay at the Solage. The property is beautiful, the pool is huge with great views, the breakfast has incredible food and the Bocce ball quart is a fun touch. The resort is a bike ride away from plenty of wineries and the resort provides the bikes! The rooms are huge and they come with private back yards. I didn't visit the Spa but I hear it is award winning. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Love the modern touches in a traditional setting”
Reviews.Author: tpappy
Reviews.Content: We (my hsband and I) came to wine country for a destination wedding weekend in October. Obviously, one of the best times of year to visit wine country. Before choosing this hotel, i look into several others. I was very well aware of the price points in this area of the state, but really didn't appreciate till I started booking this trip. It seemed that if you want 5-star, you had to pay at least $600/night. So I chose Solage because it just looked the coolest. And I was right. I love the little cottages throughout the hotel, its very private. The bikes they provide with each room were a super nice touch. We actually used them a few times. The rooms were always clean and I liked the floorplan. I would totally come back here and recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled concierge and service”
Reviews.Author: cwajda
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a great time at Solage. Hugh Clarke is a superhero. He was able to get us a reservation a certain wine country restaurant that is notoriously hard to get a seat at. I didn't really expect he'd be able to do it, but he did, which is amazing. Even if we couldn't eat there, tho, Solbar was pretty darn nice, too. The wait staff was super, as was the food. The spa was fine, but I have to admit we were let down. I'm always disappointed with the spas at resorts, tho.

Reviews.Title: “Huge potential, average experience”
Reviews.Author: fidelrobert
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews get this place down pretty accurately. It is overpriced when compared with other options up-Valley. And with minor exception, the comments about staff are dead-on. Seriously, the low-paid people at your average Apple store have better greeting skills and personal warmth. Same is true for the spa staff being stiff and cold, or at least it seems so. Just returned from my fourth stay at Solage, and I think it will be my last. Maybe give it awhile to get the details worked out or keep them the way they are and charge less. If I were the owner, I'd insist the manager be all over the place. As noted, I've been at Solage a lot, and made an effort to seek out someone who looked like management. But never saw anyone like that. I'd hire a landscape architect to dress up the place a bit. This may seem odd, but the place needs some mature trees. There really is no lobby, so it seems a little cold; that is, nowhere to get the feel of the place. It looks sterile but professional. Concrete floors. I'd also bring in some employee training on being warm and unpretentious. Avoid room 7 if you want privacy. Positives? I've had some excellent meals there. "Locals night" around the fire pit is great for conversations. Beds are heavenly. Decks are relaxing. Some employees do try hard to please. If money is no object, go there if you want to be in that area. Otherwise, give it awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Isabella091108
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying in the Napa area for a week and decided to spend 4 days in Yountville and 3 days in Calistoga. We thought it would be fun to stay in the different areas to get a different feel of everything. Our stay in Yountville at the Villagio was perfect and amazing, great free breakfast and walking distance to fabulous restaurants. The pictures of Solage looked great and the reviews were good, but this hotel just wasn’t for us. I felt like we were in the middle of nowhere. The hotel was clean and very the pools were and large. The $10 Spatini’s were not worth it and the spa which is rated so high was by far not the best spa I have ever been to or even in the top 5. The mud, the water and the rest spa experience that they offer was much overpriced and all done on your own. The spa was 10 times nicer at Villagio and I didn’t even get a service but used their sauna and was treated with more respect than at Solage where I paid $200 for services. The service was very stuffy and uptight. The $40 breakfast was horrible, 2 pieces of mushy French toast for $15 was a big disappointment. If it was good I would not mind paying the prices, but when you pay that much for breakfast it better be good. We canceled our dinner reservations that day to Sol Bar and went to Jo Le instead and were very happy that we did that. We needed to get out of that hotel. If I was able to cancel after we checked-in I would have, but it was already paid for and I would have lost my money. I would suggest staying in Yountville and making the drive to Calistoga for the wineries nearby, it’s only about a 20 minute drive and you’re much closer to better restaurants and more to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lynstersf
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit, and the service was excellent. We had a cottage with a king bed/down comforter, fireplace and pebble stone floor shower. There were robes and slippers in the room. There were also complimentary cookies, chocolate sauce, dried apricots and marshmallows. Each cottage comes with 2 bikes. The main pool is heated year-round at 88 degrees. The fitness center, while small, is well-equipped. There are complimentary yoga, spin and pilates classes in the am. I had an excellent 50 minute message for $135 at the spa. We had dinner and breakfast at the restaurant. The restaurant is excellent but has very small portions sizes, which is standard for your higher-end places in CA. Solage is located close to downtown Calistoga, but you would still have to drive. It is a smaller place and caters more to couples on romantic getaway trips (although there is a kids pool).

Reviews.Title: “All round perfection”
Reviews.Author: Ivettetrvl
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Solage has yet again proven to be perfect. We love the individual style 'cabin', outdoor patio to relax, bicycles to explore the area and the accommodating staff. Dining and facilities are top notch. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great couples getaway”
Reviews.Author: canadacoast2coast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there for 4 days in March 2012. As usual, I spent too much time focusing on the not so good comments on TA before we went. I can say that our own personal experience was great though. It is for sure not cheap, but you also get what you pay for I guess. I was a little disappointed when we first got there to see we were at the "back of the lot", but as I was checking in, there was a rather loud wedding going on (to be expected), and we were more than happy to get something that was peaceful and quiet. The distance was no problem, and was only a short walk, or literally 30 seconds on the bikes provided for each cabin. The restaurant was nice, but again pricey. I would say it's a nice place to start your day with breakfast, but there are so many choices in Calistoga (5 minute bike ride) that I would probably choose to dine in town. Some people commented on it being a long way from Napa, but if you have a car, it's not a big deal. I would say that the area around Calistoga is as nice or nicer than Napa. Has lots of great wineries, and is just as scenic. My wife had a spa treatment and said she had a great time (she's been to many so she would know) The room itself was different, but very nice. Not huge, but cozy with great beds and pillows. Love the loose coffee and filters, and selection of teas, including a "sleepy time" tea that put me out every night. the bathroom space was nice with some of the best smelling toiletries i've had in a hotel. My wife HAD to buy some at the spa before we left. The cement floors in the rooms can be a little cool, but slippers are provided. The rainfall shower was great, although it never seemed to get quite hot enough for us. Just one last comment that I have to mention pertaining to what others were saying about the grounds and landscaping at Solage. It is not "undone" but rather planted to fit in with the natural surroundings. I'm not sure f people wanted to see all grass, but I thought they were beautiful with cacti and lavender. it in perfectly, and smelled great. All in all I would highly recommend this for a great getaway to the Napa Valley. Feel fee to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Service Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Hawkmoon209
Reviews.Content: I visited Solage with some friends and couldn't have been happier. The service was outstanding from the first moment of arrival. We were escorted to our spacious cottage - two queen beds, a sitting area, large porch/patio with chair and loveseat. The spa bathroom was also spacious with 2 sinks, a bench, separate toilet, and large rain shower with pebble floor. We noticed quite a few people wandering the property in robes and then found out why - the robes are so luxurious you do not want to get out of them. We did not have any spa services but toured the spa and would most definitely get a service whenever we return - there's a coed thermal pool as well as gender specific/clothing optional pools. The hotel offers free fitness classes - we enjoyed a Core & Strength class. Each cottage comes with two courtesy beach cruisers. It is a short ride into Calistoga (less than a mile). We also ate at SolBar - very good, eclectic albeit with a somewhat limited menu. We had reservations and when we arrived our table was not yet ready - however, we were fine with it and sat in the lounge to order a pre-dinner drink. We had not been waiting 5 minutes when a waitress came over with a bottle of champagne and an apology for our wait. The waitstaff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions. Ours told us to leave room for their special beignets for dessert. However, we decided to split another dessert instead when the time came. She brought us the beignets anyway, on the house, and we devoured every last one, along with our other dessert. It was this kind of exceptional service that we enjoyed our entire stay. It's truly a beautiful resort and even though we only stayed one night, it felt like a true vacation.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: Sabina and I just returned from 3 days (and 5 Meals) at Solage and were blown away. We have stayed once before and it was amazing but the second trip was even better than the first. They are clearly capturing nearly all of our preferences and everyone knows who we are - just outstanding! I'll address the food at SolBar in a separate review but we have now had nearly a dozen meals there and every dish has been a huge hit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious, romantic, perfect”
Reviews.Author: cashmyre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 15 year anniversary with a 3-night stay at Solage Calistoga. We are so incredibly glad to have discovered this oasis, and definitely plan to return. I bought the package from LuxuryLink dot com, which came out to be a great deal. We had a Vega Studio, which was plenty big, with a king bed, seating area, covered patio, and a large bathroom. Loved having the two cruiser bikes for our own personal use; we rode all over the resort with them. The room is contemporary Cali style, with an uncluttered, clean feel, soothing colors and textures, and high-end amenities--from the fluffy robes, towels, and slippers, to the toiletries, to the custom lighting settings, and extremely comfortable bed with crisp white linens. Wi-Fi was excellent. The room was quiet, private, and just oozed mellow. We dined at Solbar several times; our package included daily breakfast and one full dinner. The food was sublimely Napa-esque: fresh and high-quality ingredients, absolutely delicious, and beautifully prepared. Like all excellent places in Napa Valley, they had a fabulous selection of wines and cocktails. Don't miss the made-to-order donut holes and dipping sauces, or the seared scallops, the beet salad, the wagyu beef...I could go on and on! We ate at the bar, inside, and on the patio--each one a lovely experience. We used the fitness room a couple of times, as well as the two different pool areas--very nice. But you cannot stay at Solage without spending some time at their world-famous spa. We did a major package which included a couples' mudslide (out of this world!), a soak in a giant tub, and then a rest/nap on some kind of heated sound/vibration chair. Followed by a couples' massage. Followed by lunch. Seriously, it was 3.5 hours of heaven and we felt like two incredibly relaxed, soft-skinned, pieces of play-doh after. Location: You are in Calistoga, the northern end of Napa Valley. Close to many excellent wineries, and the town of Calistoga, with its smaller-town charm and ambience. The other thing I want to say about Solage is how professional, warm, and welcoming the staff were. When they confirmed my reservation/package, I had told them it was our 15 year anniversary. The entire time we were there, it was like the entire staff knew this and went out of their way to make our occasion even more special. From the champagne, cheese platter, and chocolate-covered strawberries in our room at arrival, to all the complimentary drinks at Solbar, and just people coming by and saying "Happy Anniversary"--it was really wonderful and so genuine. I would recommend this place to everyone! Except my enemies--they do not deserve such a heavenly experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Would be nice at half the price”
Reviews.Author: anna78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Solage with our 3 month old son over labor day last year. We stayed in the least expensive room, which was still $700/night and at that price point I was expecting more. From the pictures I was expecting a more resort like setting but it felt more like being in a community with a lot of concrete and parking spaces. The spa pool was very nice but the main pool was just ok - basically a big pool with not a lot of atmosphere. The rooms were nice but no very big. The highlight of the property for me was the restaurant which was excellent - we had breakfast there every day of our stay. So to sum it up - for a $100 more stay at Auberge de Soleil or one of their other sister properties. You'll be disappointed if you pay more than $400/night for Solage.

Reviews.Title: “In the top tier for Napa Valley lodging”
Reviews.Author: SuperCarnitas
Reviews.Content: (Weekday stay during the off-season, booked via Jetsetter, high-$200s range for Adara King room) Along with Carneros Inn, my strongest recommendation for lodging on the Napa side of the Wine Country. I like it better than its sister property Calistoga Ranch. I'd knock off half a star for the location of our Adara King cottage: While located farther away from the main pool area, and closer towards Calistoga town center, the back of the property does edge against an apartment complex. None of the cottage windows face that way, but it's a reminder that Calistoga is a functional little town and Solage is not a secluded retreat. But everything else was pretty darned wonderful. Some highlights: * Mudslide treatment for two, at the spa, was really fun, and a relative bargain for the amount of playful couples relaxation. It's nothing like the sulfurous-smelling mud bath treatments that the traditional -- OK, California Hippie -- spas in the area are known for. Linger at the pool afterwards. * Taking the cottage bikes for a jaunt into town. * Joyriding in the house Mercedes E550 coupe. If you see the silver cars out front, ask at the front desk about the free demo drive program. * SolBar restaurant. More comments over there. * And obviously the very nice, very private rooms. All told it's similar to Carneros Inn or the aforementioned Calistoga Ranch. As a quick comparison, I thought the Calistoga Ranch rooms were nicer and more secluded (with remote location, tedious golf-cart-shuttle access); and the Carneros Inn was more picturesque (with remote location, requiring a car drive for all off-site activity).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LuvTrvl31
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Calistoga because a friend from the area recommended it. We originally planned on staying at Mt View in downtown Calistoga, but it was booked up for the rooms that would accommodate 4 ladies and boy, were we glad that we ended up at Solage! This place is beautiful! The ONLY reason why I'm not giving it a 5 star rating is because some of the staff was a bit stuffy, however the majority were wonderful! Rooms- The layout is the first thing that sets it apart. Its a room, but it's actually your own little cottage with two cruiser bikes to use at your leisure. Every room had a patio with a sitting area and a great view. There was some weird prairie grass mess that surrounded our patio. Im sure it was some kind of attempt at making it look rustic-chic, but in my opinion, it wasn't aesthetically pleasing and at one point we heard some kind of animal moving around in it. (luckily, we never had the pleasure of meeting said animal). The beds were comfy and the room itself had plenty of space for four ladies and our luggage. The bathroom was nice and big, but I really wish they had a bathtub! The bath amenities smelled great and were from a local place, but none of us liked how the shampoo and conditioner made our hair feel, so bring your own. (the soap and lotion were just fine and all amenities were full size bottles). We all loved that there was a coffee maker with a jar of coffee from a local shop, as well as an electric kettle to make tea! Yum! (the tropical green was a favorite!) They also give you a complimentary reusable tote to take with you, some snacks like trail mix to munch on and a bottle of wine that was pretty good. Most importantly, it was nice and clean! The Spa- Ahhh-Mazing!!!! We didn't want to leave! We did the mud slide treatment which was wonderful - we had our own sauna room set up for the four of us (which was nice because this treatment is best done in the nude) so we didn't have to feel all awkward in front of strangers. They give you cucumbers for your eyes and delicious flavored ice water. Then, after you shower off the mud, they take you to a warm scented bath to relax in and finally, the anti-gravity, sound vibration chair. Two of us loved it and fell asleep - the other two thought the chair was just ok. We all had massages later in our stay and those were wonderful. Our favorite part of the spa was the warm mineral pool surrounded by olive trees and peaceful serenity. They tap into the local hot spring water and this pool was the PERFECT temp! They also have separate men's and women's lounge areas where you can lay by a large hot tub (sans clothes if you so choose) or sit in the eucalyptus steam room and then run out and jump into the little cold plunge pool - it was quite exhilarating! Lastly, the spa food and drinks were delicious, so have some!! Solbar - We had a couple of us in our group with food sensitivities and we were always able to find something delicious to eat. The fresh fruit juice in the morning was incredible. (the pear was my fav). If you like oatmeal, it's not to be missed here. Seriously, we all loved our breakfast every morning. We had dinner and drinks on the patio. The food was amazing (I think the best dinner we had and we tried a new place each night) and the wine impeccable. It was a little chilly out and not only did they bring us our own heater, but the manager came and wrapped a pashmina around me to use while I was sitting there. I loved it so much that I bought one from him! The only negative thing I can say is that although it's a very nice place, you still need to keep an eye on your things! You tend to get a bit relaxed - everyone here looks like they stepped out of a J Crew catalog and everyone is nice and there to enjoy themselves. However, we did have one incident where we were laying by the main pool and the young bartender was feeding us free drinks. Who am I to complain - this place isn't cheap, so if you want to load us up with free drinks...ok. Though, I think we MAY have been taken. At one point we noticed the bartender talking to some guy that appeared to be a local - definitely not a guest a the hotel. You need your room key to access the pool and he did come in when a guest was leaving. We were enjoying ourselves and our bag was a few feet away. Two of us grabbed what we though was all of our things and headed back to the room while the other two hung out by the hot tub. Long story short, someone stole our bag. So, I would just keep an eye on your things. I'm hoping this was just an isolated instance and it shouldn't deter anyone from staying here - the place is great! I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Save the 50th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: ragazza000
Reviews.Content: We got hosed by Indian River Resort down the street and contacted Solage last minute (on a holiday weekend). Not only did they accommodate us, but gave us a bit of a discount to offset the cost difference. The staff was AMAZING (even had one sweet guy fetch a martini late at night - not even his "job"). Everyone goes out of their way to care for you. The spa was DEVINE! They have private male/female areas that have a hot mineral pool, cold dunk and eucalyptus steam. Plenty of "couples" stuff, too. Solbar (restaurant) food was delicious, and the bar has a very fun menu of mixed cocktails. Especially loved that every bungalow (or suite) had bikes. We were able to even ride up to several wineries. DO NOT MISS LAVA VINE (dark chocolate, olive oil and sea salt nibbles accompanied our Port)! Be sure to love on the labs at B Cellars! Solage will be a return destination, for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a question or two on the spa”
Reviews.Author: londrepyramid
Reviews.Content: We were part of a group and spent 3 nights at the property. Loved the internal layout of the cottages and the location was lovely. The customer service was reserved but helpful. We had 2 bikes provided with the cottage and we used them to explore the site and neighbouring area(nice and flat). Played Boules and the breakfast service had a great choice all well executed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Solage for two nights for New Years, with our dog. I really liked how this place is so pet friendly, although that is very common in the Napa Valley. I like how the place is extremely close to Calistoga, yet not right in town. Everything at this place is very modern and minimalist. The pool looked very cool and I'm sure its quite the scene in the summertime (was too cold to try when we were there). The views from the hotel of the mountains are great. We tried Solbar one night for dinner and had excellent food (especially the kobe beef). The drinks were decent, but I'd stick with standard wine, beer, and mixed drinks, rather than their concoctions. We didn't try using the bikes to ride around the countryside, but wish that we had. That looked like a lot of fun. We liked how every morning, there was a smell of fresh herbs when we left the room. We could've stayed at this place a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: erin2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solage for one night for a mini babymoon and had a lovely time. All of the staff was super friendly. The grounds are gorgeous, somewhat remote and nestled in the Napa foothills. The pool and fountains are beautiful; there are bocce courts and bikes for your use. The property is within walking distance of downtown Calistoga. Our cottage was very nice with a comfortable bed and linens and a modern vibe. It's the extras that make a vacation for me, and I love that the room comes with a coffee maker, ground coffee (not packaged), tea, sugar and creamers in the fridge. The room also has an ipod docking station and magazines. And we received bottled waters for the road when we checked out. We booked the romance package, which included credits for dinner and breakfast at the Solbar. We have eaten there several times, and each time the food has been fabulous. (Michelin agrees with me.) The bacon is some of the best I've ever had. My only nitpicky comments are (1) that we had to call the bar from our cellphone to order drinks by the pool. I guess poolside service was discontinued for the season. It wasn't a big deal to walk the few yards from the pool to the bar, but for $500+ a night it would be nice to get a drink by the pool whenever I darn well feel like it (especially since the pool/hot tub is such a draw of the resort for me); and (2) the cottages are so close that I didn't feel like sitting out on the patio due to lack of privacy. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: debreem
Reviews.Content: In full disclosure for this review, we are still at the Solage about 3/4 through our stay. I have been so impressed with the service and our stay that I figured I should write this post while it is still fresh! We are staying a total of 6 days at the Solage over the new year holiday and into the first week of January and our experience here has been nothing short of fantastic. We are staying in a Vega studio just behind the gym and spa buildings with views of the mountains. The Vega studio is a great space. The layout is fantastic, with a somewhat minimalist and comfortable design. The shower has great pressure and the stone floor in the shower is amazing. The mini-bar area is stocked with complimentary coffee and creamer, from a local roaster. There is free wifi, a flatscreen, and a great outdoor patio with seating. The entire grounds have been laid out and designed to feel even bigger than they actually are. The fresh, clean look of the buildings combined with the barn like feel creates a perfectly relaxing atmosphere. The hot pools, especially since it is January here, are fantastic and while we haven't made use of the main pool or bocce ball courts, they are well kept and we have seen many people using them. The best part of our stay, however, has been the personal touches. The staff is welcoming and friendly. We checked in on New Years Eve and decided to eat at the Sol Bar. Just before our meal, a staff person dropped off a "hangover kit" at our room in a cute little bag filled with gatorade, water, advil, etc. A very nice touch! We had a very good meal. The wine pairings were great, in particular, we had two really nice pairings of Stoney Hill Chardonnay with a scallops dish and Heitz Cabernet Sauvignon with a kobe beef dish. Our server was incredibly accomodating and allowed what would have been a four course sharing into an 8 course sharing. The ambiance is gorgeous inside. The bar area is also a good size and the mixed drinks are supposed to be very good. After dinner, we came back to a bottle of champagne and some food in our room, a total surprise from the Solage. They also deliver fresh mint water at night in great little milk jars and lay out a thought of the day on your bed. Last but not least, the spa and gym. My boyfriend and I have both used the gym facility every day so far. It is small but completely adequate. Clean, well kept, new machines. The treadmills and ellipticals have t.v.'s attached and there is a good size free weights area. They offer daily classes in a studio area next door though neither of us have taken them. My boyfriend got a massage at the spa and it lived up to all the hype. The spa facilities are fantastic. It is calm and serene. The locker rooms are sizable and there are also phenomenal steam rooms for both men and women. The only possible downside is that it is in Calistoga, tucked a bit away. But it is located right on the Silverado Trail which is gorgeous and we have loved being just a bit outside the rush and main mix. It is a quick 15-20 minute drive to St. Helena, easy to get to Healdsburg and the drive down Silverado to Rutherford, Yountville, Napa, etc is 30-45 minutes depending where you are headed. We haven't minded the location at all but could understand how others might want to be closer to St. Helena or elsewhere. I am sure I am forgetting some of the details of our stay but we cannot recommend the Solage enough. As one last aside, it looks like the management did respond to past comments and there are now ipod docking stations in all of the rooms, a very nice touch! We would return to the Solage with no hesitation, couldn't have asked for a more enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quiet Location but Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: MariG0216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with my parents. We got a number of spa treatments and spent a lot of time wine tasting over the weekend. The hotel grounds were clean and well kept. The cottages were comfortable and nicely maintained. The decor in the cottages is very modern and minimalist. Our experience at the spa was good -- Massages were decent, nothing to complain about. The food at the restaurant was delicious too. My only complaint is that the service had a few glitches. For instance, at check in, our room was not ready. We had dinner reservations one evening at 9:00 pm and had to wait over 40 minutes for our table. Since we were eating so late, we were really hungry. At a minimum, I would have expected them to give us a drink or appetizer. Another day, we ate at the restaurant for lunch. We got there about 10 minutes before they opened, but we were told to wait on the patio and that they would seat us once they were open. We sat out front waiting (there were not many guests around) and no one came to seat us even after they were open. We had to go up and ask. On another occasion, we had a bunch of treatments scheduled at the spa. Some of our treatments started late which was annoying. Overall, this place has a lot of potential but could definitely improve their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: castarlet
Reviews.Content: Truly one of the best days of my life. Such a relaxing experience...there was no way to resist it. Loved the mudslide, scrub and massage. (Top 5 massages ever actually...) Everyone was so friendly, and the place was so serene...I lust to go back there as soon as possible. Absolutely amazing. Thank you! THE best choice for a spa in Napa Valley, I'm certain!

Reviews.Title: “Luxe escape with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: A two day visit to Solage was a holiday season girl's weekend getaway for a friend and I. I had carefully researched our choice of venue, and was looking for a modern yet peaceful escape. We booked the "girl's getaway" package, which is a bit of a splurge, and we had pretty high expectations. The resort is simple, modern and polished. It is minimalist in design, and the 89 bungalows are spread out over the property - our hope was for a quiet, classy weekend enjoying the amenities and the gorgeous surroundings. Our initial impression, however, was the exact opposite of what we were looking for. We arrived at 4pm on Friday afternoon after having driven from San Francisco, and the lobby was absolute chaos. We waited for a couple minutes to check in, and while the guest service agent was trying to be courteous and helpful, there were two couples checking in beside us were obviously quite intoxicated (too much wine tasting perhaps), very loud and totally obnoxious. We couldn't hear the guest service agent at all and even got pushed aside by one of the women. We waited for this group to leave, then finished our check in. All in all, NOT a peaceful experience. It is obviously not the hotel's fault that this group was loud if this is the type of clientele the Solage attracts, we would not find what we were looking for (and had paid top dollar for). After settling to our room, we started to relax a little more and were really delighted by the property. It has the propensity to be very peaceful. The bungalows are beautifully decorated, extremely modern, spacious and very comfortable. The rooms are decorated in earthy, cool tones and have large slate bathrooms, simple furniture, complimentary cruiser bikes and private patios. Luckily, the property is spread out and very spacious, and our bungalow was very peaceful. The common areas, however, were really crowded and the "lobby crowd" could be heard from the pool all the way into the lounge. The hotel did apologize for the less-than-stellar arrival, but unless they manage the expectations of their clientele, this will continue to be an issue. We wanted an escape, not a party hotel. We had a couple more service issues in the spa, which were really unfortunate, because I really wanted to love the Solage. It has all the trappings of a perfect retreat - beautiful decor, incredible location, great food. The pool and common areas are beautiful, and the hotel is even pet friendly! However, the staff just seemed to be a little overwhelmed (there seemed to be a couple Christmas parties and it was very busy). My friend and I were "accidentally" booked into the same treatment room for our spa treatment, which was pretty awkward. The spa staff rectified it by staggering our appointments, but then unfortunately completely forgot about me. I waited in the treatment room for 15 minutes before realizing they were never coming back. At that point, I had been in the spa for over an hour waiting and was fed up. My impression was that the spa and the hotel were just too busy for the staffing levels. If the service glitches can get solved, this will be an incredible property. I would definitely go back in the low season because this is a property that deserves to be relished. I would be very hesitant, however, to book in high season because the amenities just do not seem to have the capacity, not if you are looking for an exceptional experience. To me, there rooms are just too expensive to have a poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Classy yet understated”
Reviews.Author: SailAwaySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service from reception to dining. Some rooms don't have a bathtub so if that is a requirement you should doublecheck at booking. The breakasts were the highlight of dining at Solage. My favorite was the trout with poached eggs and the mexican masa was a close second. Both of these dishes could serve one. Our server, Tim, made sure we were well taken care of. We tried bar food from shrimp lettuce cups to pizzas. All were delicious. In the dining room the duck was ok, but the salad with Lily's egg was the highlight. Delicious. Wednesday night is no corkage fee....can't beat that! Beach cruisers are fun and the location of the resort is perfect for exploring Calistoga or biking to wineries. Not sure I would pay full price but will definitely return with an auction package!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, beautiful spa, and I LOVED the complimentary bikes”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTati
Reviews.Content: This was a girls' weekend with 4 ladies for 3 days in wine country. The grounds are beautiful. Winding pathways and beautiful little sculptures with water features. Locations in Napa/Sonoma/Calistoga aren't very convenient, but this is very close to Sterling. In fact, the report has complimentary bikes to use and Sterling is just a couple miles away. I like that we stayed in a stand-alone cabin. It was very spacious (a couch in the bathroom). I rate the value as average because it certainly isn't cheap, but you get what you pay for. All of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The spa and restaurant are phenomenal. Even if you don't purchase an addiitona spa treatment, be sure to visit the spa because there are lovely heated pools.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a terrific resort.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckLLB
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights over the Thanksgiving long weekend at Solage Calistoga. Overall we were very impressed with the style and design of the property and the accommodations. Solage offers separate little studios or bungalows for each guest and each comes with a pair of bikes. Our studio was well appointed, spacious and include a few nice touches such as the best hotel robes I've ever experienced as well as quality bathroom products. The service at the hotel was excellent - whether at reception, with the concierge or at the spa. The massages at the spa were also fantastic - among the best we've had - and use of the spa also gave us access to the separate pools, hot tubs and steam rooms available for spa guests. Although not inexpensive, I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a modern, relaxing and luxurious twist on Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for 2 nights. The rooms are spacious. It is nice how the property is laid out, you have your own separate bungalow with private patio. The pool is awesome, we loved it. The conceirge was extremely helpful. After we booked our reservation then we emailed him and he set up our itinerary for the day to go to 4 different wineries and he set up transportation for us. We ate dinner at Solbar, it was good but I wouldn't say it was the best. But then again we are from Chicago, so I am a little biased. On the day we were leaving we ordered breakfast room service and it is from Solbar. I would say our breakfast was delicious, Lemon-ricotta pancakes with blueberry syrup and egg white omelet with spinach and goat cheese. Overall everything was very nice. If you don't need the concierge services I am sure you could find a nice vacation rental for less money

Reviews.Title: “Best Modern Resort in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: PVGreg
Reviews.Content: Solage Calistoga is likely the best new modern hotel/resort in all of the Napa Valley area. I have stayed at most of the newer properties but none equal Solage. I am a swimmer so the almost 50 yard pool was beyond my expectations. The Spa is beatiful and the SolBar restaurant is excellent. We loved the modern minimalist but elegant style of the rooms. The layout of the single story cottage/room clusters makes the property feel expansive. Small grass areas with art works or fountains adjoin the buildings creating neighborhood like plazas. We will stay here anytime we venture to the Napa area. The personal bikes for every room are a nice touch and if we had more time we would have used them. Beds are hard but thats how I like them. Cool shower but there are no tubs in the entry level room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 360kcbiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a convention in SF and loved the resort. The photos on the website are dead-on. It really is that beautiful, relaxing and wonderful. My husband is an architect, and the aesthetics for us were perfect - we loved every detail. We spent a day in the spa (getting a mudslide and one of the best massages I've ever had) and then a day at the pool. The first morning I wandered over to the work out room, which was spotless and well equipped, but it was so nice outside I thought I might jog. The gentleman at the spa desk recommended a route directly across the hotel - which I ended up running every day. Jogging through the mountain mist along a small, quiet road with vineyards on either side of me...sigh. After the jog, I waded into the heated spa pool and floated in the rising steam breathing in the crisp mountain air. Heaven. Absolute heaven. The food was wonderful, service was wonderful, everything was wonderful. (Tip - Ask the concierge about the beautiful Mercedes sitting in front of the hotel - it will be worth it.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Rosjuan
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect place for its surroundings. It makes you feel like being in a luxury country wine bungalow. Food is great, the pool awesome. You even have your own bikes. Perfect place for the wine lands. One of the best spas i've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: ndestin
Reviews.Content: Solage exceeded our lofty expectations in many areas. We arrived early for our room and were greeted cheerfully from the front desk. After a delicious lunch at Solbar we were informed by our waiter that our room was ready. We stayed in an Adara Suite, which is at one end of the spacious resort. Our room and patio overlooked beautiful old oaks. We watched hawks, quail, and others feeding in our backyard. Our room was lovely and modern. The pebbled floor shower was a treat for the feet. Turndown service is fabulous and decadent. The sheets are soft and wonderful as well as simple with just a duvet. The resort is so close to downtown Calistoga and easy to access by bike, foot, or car. It is a charming town. Many vineyards are located right out of the resort. The food and ambience at Solbar on the patio was wonderful. We ate lunch and dinner there several times and enjoyed everything. We found the prices fair for the location, food, and service. Solage is not a "fancy" resort, rather a peaceful oasis in a beautiful location in the Napa Valley. It is laid back, provides excellent service, and serves as great place to explore the area. We highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: jnlee99
Reviews.Content: Spend two night there as part of my company function. The accommodations were excellent! Bed was so comfortable and the back porch was perfect for little down time to get me back to my center. I would go back anytime and it's only about 1.5 hours drive from the City. I regret that I didn't get to try to spa, but the in-room bath was very nice. I especially like the roomy shower with the pebble floor. The fireplace was also a nice touch. I would call this an ultimate luxury camping experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Engagement!”
Reviews.Author: Hammercules
Reviews.Content: Ahh Solage... only accolades! Right from the booking you just know it's going to be perfect! The whole region is about attaining perfection, with the wines, the food, the hotels, and of course the service. And Solage does not disappoint! This trip was particularly special seeing as I planned to propose and Solage and it's staff where excellent in helping me attain the perfect moment to ask her about forever! Guest services were in contact with me several times to help me organize the perfect set of days while staying at Solage. The tasty and refreshing checking drinks. Use of the cruiser bikes for our own little wine tour around the block. A great fitness & yoga center. And the helpful and prefect organization of the surprise spa for 2 and private cabana. The room was just incredible and the bed heavenly and private garden and whirlpool ! And of course, I have to mention the amazing amazing food at Solbar restaurant! (Did I say, Amazing? it was really good!) I was so lucky to have some many staff members in on, and help me with the surprise proposal. I'll tell myself she would have said yes no matter where I asked her, but our stay at the lovely Solage, Calistoga, made it something she/we will truly never forget! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational!”
Reviews.Author: Chief_Brief
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a v well designed, well appointed, beautiful studio with everything you could wish for. It was west-facing with a little terrace so we caught the sunset. There's bikes provided & we cycled into & around Calistoga. The staff are super-obliging. Room service was prompt & friendly. There's an enormous pool for adults only (yay!). Everything was absolutely perfect for a relaxing chill-out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Reston10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in a basic studio room. This is a resort-style hotel with duplex rooms throughout a multi-acre property. The room was truly a studio. There was a porch with some outdoor furniture accessed by sliding glass doors. The room had a king-sized bed, a couple of comfortable (but small) chairs at the foot of the bed, a television on a stand, and a narrow desk. There was a minibar area with a stocked fridge and coffeemaker (10-cup). Our room lacked a bathtube, but had a nice shower. Each room had a couple of cruiser bikes. Pros: great restaurant (good outdoor seating), three pools (one large adult pool, one mineral pool at the spa, and one children's pool). Despite being 95+ degrees every day, the adult pool was chilly (so-so service at the pool). The mineral pool was much warmer, but very subdued (spa atmosphere). The fitness center was tops...tons of cardio equipment, free weights, and weight machines. Might have been the best hotel gym I've ever seen. For the most part, service was top-notch (to be expected for such a hotel). The room was about $600/night. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure zen-like and more...”
Reviews.Author: princessmango
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Vega studio; clean fresh,high ceilings, modern with a wonderful sunny and private backyard. The breakfast at sunrise on the patio with heaters was magical. The gym (must have) was airy, bright, well exiped. Missed a free yoga class...3 pools (separate for children; fantastic idea). The mineral pool was absolutely heavenly...perfect tempreture with great bar service...there are also 2 areas where you can tan "au-naturel" separate M/F with cool h2o whirl bath and steam room. The mud treatment was a fantastic experience! Bicycles definately a bonus, U won't ride far and a perfect way to explore the small village. We've had a truly relaxing stay with NO glitz....a perfect little hideway...our next stay will be longer for sure...and if you forget your bathing suite or anything else the wonderful spa shop will fill your needs....

Reviews.Title: “bikes are great, front desk a bit unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: travelrabbit2003
Reviews.Content: we came here for a quick trip after a wedding in San Francisco, and wanted to briefly experience wine country. We didn't have very much time, but wanted to do it all. The complimentary bikes are great, and we had a fantastic time riding around wine country. The pool is so relaxing, and the poolside service is great. We loved the room, with its secluded terrace, and perfect rainhead shower. The restaurant is a must, and there was an organized star-gazing, which was FANTASTIC. It made us a bit sad that more people weren't interested in this activity, because the sky was so clear and the guys running it were very knowledgable. The day we were checking out, we asked at the front desk if it was possible to have a late check out, so we could use the bikes a bit longer. Unfortunately, the rather grumpy manager at the front desk told us that she could only give us 1 hour late check out (although it did not seem nearly full at the time--mid-week). Despite this, we had a fantastic time, but would have expected more service for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would be nice at half the price”
Reviews.Author: scott g
Reviews.Content: I think my wife & i coined this phrase on our recent visit as the perfect summation of Solage. Its certaintly not a bad property- but at $700 a night for a basic studio room, i defintely expected a lot more. Room was small, simple, and didnt even have a dresser for our clothes which was odd. The property, while clean and new, feels like a huge asphalt parking lot- no real character. We went to Aubrege for dinner (as sister property of Solage) and quickly regretted not booking there. If you are going to Napa and spending this kind of money for lodging- try Aubrege or Calistoga Ranch. Skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewels1698
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Solage last fall for a Napa getaway. The cottage concept was novel for us, and really nice. The rooms were wonderful, clean and efficient. The bathrooms were great, large soaking tub (which i never used). We used the (free) bikes to go in to Calistoga each day and love that. The little patio was a wonderful place to have breakfast each morning and a glass of wine at night. The pool was massive and quiet. There is a kiddie pool adjacent, but noise level was low. We had a couples mud treatment at the hotel. i would not do this again, I would go into Calistoga proper and have the service - would save $$ and I believe they have vats of mud - the spa had little buckets that you had to self apply. (however, we did enjoy the heated pool at the spa). I had a massage which was not memorable, but I'm sure enjoyable. We also did the relaxation chairs - again, interesting but would not splurge for this treatment again. August Briggs vineyard was just down the road - this is a little gem of a vineyard. Calistoga is a bit off the beaten track, but for us, we needed the space to recharge. We had dinner closer to the heart of Napa and used the hotel arranged car service. Was worth it to enjoy wine and not worry about driving. The hotel helped us ship cases of wine back to our home. The staff really did go out of their way to do anything to make us more comfortable. We stayed for a week and that was just about the perfect length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Heaven”
Reviews.Author: LAgirltravels
Reviews.Content: The Solage hotel was a perfect place to stay for a vacation that included wine tasting, amazing dining, exercise, pool time and hiking. The studios are like little houses, beautifully and thoughtfully decorated with nice patios. Each cottage comes with two bikes which was a perfect way to ride into town (5 minutes away) or along the streets surrounding all the luscious vineyards. I did get chased by a large dog, which gave me a small heart attack but he turned out to be friendly. The food at the Solage is amazing and we had one of our best meals at Solbar, their restaurant. Breakfast is also really delicious. Everyone we met on the staff is very friendly and helpful and the concierge was great in helping us to book dinner reservations, wine tastings, etc. The pool area is large and the staff there takes very good care of you. I didn't go to the spa, but looked inside and it's very nice. St Helena is about a 15 to 20 minute drive away where there are many great shops and restaurants, including Farmstead (my favorite) and Oakville Grocery to pick up lunch. For a quick excursion we drove about 40 minutes to Guernville where you can take a hike inside a redwood forest and then hangout on the "beach" at the river. I've stayed at the Carneros Inn several times, which I love so much but the Solage was so great it would be hard to decide between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Solage, A wonderful place to connect with your loved one”
Reviews.Author: Skubi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Solage in Calistoga for two blissful nights. Our Capella Suite was superb, and incredibly romantic. This suite includes a private patio which is beautifully furnished and is very private. There is a gurgling fountain and a private spa that makes it so that you never want to leave the room. The bath is so well appointed with separate sinks, a large bath tub and a separate steam shower. We had breakfast delivered every morning, and the food was superb. The spa on the property is one of the nicest we have ever visited. Our massage left us very relaxed and the use of the spa mineral pool is a must and worth the extra cost to use it. Have a "Spa-tini"! Overall, if you need a get away to reconnect, this is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Solage!”
Reviews.Author: Aimee N
Reviews.Content: After 9 years of being away from Calistoga, we had decided to bring our two kids along. Finding a nice place, that's kid friendly was a challenge! But when my husband called the Solage, we knew this is the place for us. At first, (based on the website) we didn't think this would be a kid friendly place, but it was. The Concierge went out of her way to help us locate a babysitting service, so that we can have some alone time. We love everything about the Solage, from the spacious room, soft sheets, to the beautiful bathroom, and especially, the glass recycled water bottle and bikes... The kid's pool was a plus. This way, the kids could scream and not distrub other guests. We have stayed at many different places in the Napa Valley before, but the Solage will be the place we'll definitely return to again!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here”
Reviews.Author: ccoward
Reviews.Content: Solage - Wow! Where to start? Firstly, this is one of the best resorts we have ever stayed in, hands down. Secondly, if you are travelling to San Francisco from Australia and want to include the Napa Valley on your itinerary I cannot recommend enough that you hire a car and drive up to Calistoga for a few days and that you stay at Solage. It will beat any day trip that a travel brochure will describe. Okay, let's break it down. Arrival/Check-in Seamless, friendly, professional. As soon as we parked our car we were greeted by a bellman who ushered us into reception and offered us cold towels and water (it was hot out). We already received a pre arrival email from the spa and concierge so made bookings for treatments and dinner prior to arriving which were confirmed at checking. The same bellman then asked us to follow him as he cycled to where out studio was. He helped us unpack, talked us through the features of the room and resort and suggested some places in town for dinner. Our Room We booked a Vega Studio which was perfect - very close to the fitness centre and spa. The room was very modern - king bed, locally made amenities in the bathroom, large double shower, great selection of tea and coffee and an outdoor terrace that opened onto a large area of trees. Also worth mentioning the free, resort wide wifi coverage as well. Perfect for seamless connectivity whether you are in your room of by the pool. We had daily maid service and an evening turndown service. Again, a lovely touch in that the bottled water provided are in reusable glass bottles and are flavoured with citrus and cucumber. We loved that each room came with two bikes to use - we really only used them to circle the resort a few times but we did see people using them during the day to tour wineries and get into town at night for dinner. Resort Grounds Stunning! Perfectly landscaped for the climate. Sunset at Solage is divine. Relax with a glass of wine and soak it in. The whole resort is laid out like a village with pockets of housing and pathways with centred around some truly original sculptures. The resort is also pet friendly and it was fun to see lots of people walking their dogs. Spa The Spa is how we heard about Solage as it was recently voted one of the top Spas in America by Conde Nast Traveller. The Spa is located together with the fitness centre and set out across four pavilions. The main pavilion includes the Spa check in/shop, locker rooms and waiting lounges. Across from this area is the fitness studio and next to that is the pavilion where group classes are held each day. Further across is the bathhouse area which includes a bar for light meals and refreshments, treatment rooms, outdoor gender separate clothing optional areas (features hot spa, cold plunge, steam and deck chairs) and a central pool with more chairs and private cabanas. We both booked in for massage and agreed that they were possible the best we've ever received. Lots of couples were also doing the Mudslide treatment but we already had another mud treatment booked at Indian Springs so didn't partake (next time). I cannot recommend enough that if you are coming to Solage, you book in for a treatment. it's also worth noting that the pool in the bathhouse pavilion is much more relaxed (piped music, quieter crowd) than the main, family pool area located over on the other side of the resort near the restaurant. Fitness Centre Free classes are held every day ranging from high intensity stuff (i.e. Spin) to calmer stuff (i.e. Yoga). The Fitness Centre locker rooms open early in the morning at the same time as the fitness centre (5am) and include a steam room if you can't wait for the bathhouse to open. There is lots of well maintained equipment for cardio, weights and stretching. A really impressive setup. Staff Every staff member that we encountered was courteous and friendly. It's worth mentioning this because everyone, grounds staff to waiters to spa staff always smiled and said hello. A really slick operation with some great management. Dining Our only disappointment was Solbar. We were excited after everything people had been saying and from the look of the menu. Don't get us wrong, the food was amazing but the service really let the whole experience down. Maybe they were having an off night but here's how it unfolded - the greeter seemed to come across as though she has a better place to be. There was zero consistency in service all night - every order taken and every plate bought to the table was by someone different. There was supposed to be a Sommelier but he didn't visit us (shame because the wine list was amazing). I did want to make a special mention of an AMAZING desert that I had though. Stout (yes, Stout!!!) ice-cream with pretzels and burnt caramel sauce. O.M.G. Sounds crazy but it was one of the most perfectly unique things I've ever tasted. In Summary..... It was tough leaving Solage and it certainly a place we will make time to visit again. There are so many wineries around this area that it would be very easy to come for a week, hit the wine trail every morning and lounge at the spa every afternoon. Get here soon people - it truly is a five star deal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing first trip to Napa will definately return to Solage”
Reviews.Author: Nikmtay
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, clean, and tranquil facility. We LOVED the Solage and will return again. The rooms were amazing. On the smaller side but VERY nice. The shower was our favorite. Very modern and relaxing. We would recomment this location to anyone. Not too far from Napa but just far enought to feel secluded. Very friendly staff. Bocce ball courts were a nightly favorite for us. We even had our own personal breakfast buffet and personal crochet match with couples on our trip. Bikes were neat. Spa was amazing. Very nice pool with food and drink service during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Such a relaxing Father's Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Amy25
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Solage in June. The weather was hot, but we enjoyed sitting at the family pool and using the spa and gym. The gym is really terrific, and I loved the mineral pools. My husband had a good facial and mud treatment. Our cottage was nice and cool during the hot days, and we loved the cool shower with the stone floor. There was a wedding taking place at the resort when we were there, and while they did dominate one half of the family pool area, they were pretty mellow. It actually made for great people watching while we ate our fish tacos! It is a shame it is so expensive. And sadly, it's one of the most "reasonably priced" resorts in Napa- which is a terrifying thought. But they seem to be able to fill the $500-600 a night rooms, so I suppose we're stuck with our infrequent visits.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but don't stay there during a wedding”
Reviews.Author: WHY49
Reviews.Content: The food, accomodations, spa, and pool are wonderful, but they had a large wedding the weekend we were there, and I thought I was back at a frat party while sitting around the pool. The football throwing in the pool didn't allow us to swim, caused a racket, and splashed us as men ran the sides and dove for throws. Such a classy resort should have stepped in. We finally left the pool area because we felt like we were at a municipal pool, not a first class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDoneThat740
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Solage several times for a quick getaway. We are never disappointed. In a word it's blissful.... the architecture and decor, the well maintained grounds, the pool, the spa, the delicious on site food and good service, the nicely appointed rooms and the cruiser bikes at every cottage door.... make it hard to leave the resort! We usually stay for three nights, and leave wanting one more. The only negative would be that although the rooms are nicely appointed they are bit small, but it never seems to be a problem, and I am complainer when it comes to hotel rooms. We have also stayed at the Calistogo Ranch, which I believe is their sister property, but found their recently increased rates ($1200 plus per night) not worth it with the Solage as an option and we prefer the proximity to town the Solage offers. Room tip: call the property and request a room near the oaks behind the spa (might be a higher category room). These rooms have patios that look over a ravine with oaks that are home to red tailed hawks that we've watched hunt, granted hawks can a bit loud! Also, we find these rooms are more private and lend themselves to walking or riding our cruiser to the main area of the resort. Additionally like all seasonal areas the room rates fluctuate with the seasons... I would guess from $350 pn to $700 pn. our rate this last stay was somewhere towards the high middle.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort; everything was simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: This resort is simply amazing. We splurged and opted for the stand-alone cottage and it did not disappoint. Everything about the room was fabulous, including the private back yard and hot tub. The furnishings were neutral and felt very inviting. There was a nice bathroom with separate shower and tub, separate living area with kitchenette. The bed was amazingly comfortable and we didn't really want to leave the room. But, the outdoor part of the cottage was so nice. We loved the beach bicycles. I took a stroll around Calistoga and that was fun. I really love the resort property. It's big. You can park your car right in front of your room/cottage and you feel like you are the only people there. We also ate dinner at the restaurant, which was phenomenal. The food, service, dessert....all amazing. We really loved this place and will definitely go back. As an added benefit, the hotel sent us a letter inviting us back for an additional stay, at a discounted rate. They really know how to run a resort. Nice touch. Our only regret is not staying longer. Like another guest commented.....can we move in??

Reviews.Title: “Too Nice to Leave”
Reviews.Author: Bldd21
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I journeyed to Solage for the July 4th Weekend. We had intended to explore the Napa area, while using Solage as a "home base". We settled in, explored the grounds, which includes a private mineral pool. The ambiance was so lovely, so serene, that for three days, we never left the premises! We enjoyed breakfast, lunch, and dinner in the restaurant. One morning, we enjoyed breakfast on our outdoor patio. The yoga class was A plus. The spa services were superb, as was each massage therapist. For a relaxing and nourishing get away....Solage Spa is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, wonderful Food!”
Reviews.Author: SnapperJam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Solage at the start of this year. They could not have been more accommodating, and their staff were brilliant. We ate at Solbar, their one star Michellin restaurant and loved the food. The property is large and you have your own "cabin" of sorts. They provide you with two beach cruisers per cabin and it's a short walk into the charming town of Calistoga. My father had a massage at the spa and he claimed it was the best he had ever received. He was in fact walking straighter after his visit! I can't recommend Solage enough!

Reviews.Title: “The spa was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the hotel but the spa was recommended to us by some Napa locals. Lunch at Solbar was fabulous, then off to Spa Solage. The guys had 50 minute massages and the girls did the mud slide treatment. The spa atmostphere is incredible and we wished we could've spent more time there, but had to get back to Napa. The mud slide was a bit of a 'do it yourself' spa service, where you put the mud on yourself, lay in a sauna for 15 minutes, shower it off. They take you to a salt bath, where you lounge for 10 minutes, then they take you to the zero gravity chair, where you nap for 20 minutes. We took a quick dip in the pool afterwards and really enjoyed the experience overall. Next time I'll visit the mud baths in Calistoga just to have something to compare this experience to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms, Great Staff, Best Restaurant in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: kkeyser27
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms were really well thought out... basically like a little house, with a very, very nice bathroom that beats most Four Seasons bathrooms by a long shot. Amazing shower, huge soaking tub, dual vanities, all set behind the bedroom. The staff was very nice. Thomas, who greeted us when we arrived, is an incredibly nice guy and gave us tons of advice about places to eat in Calistoga, how to get around, etc. We ate at Sol Bar one night for our anniversary and it was the best dining experience we have had in a very long time. Michelin-Star quality food and service. The only place that gives it a run for its money is Auberge, but the Sol Bar was a little more fun and seemed to be a younger crowd. Solage is also located walking distance from downtown Calistoga, which is very convenient... but if you do not want to walk they provide each room with two cruiser bikes. We also love that some rooms are dog-friendly. Overall, some of the best rooms around, amazing food, great location, beautiful spa, and great staff. The people at Auberge Resorts definitely know what they are doing and seem to create unique, beautiful properties that also have amazing food.

Reviews.Title: “Would move in if we could...”
Reviews.Author: jengator
Reviews.Content: We were glad that we did a few wine tours before we checked into Solage, because once we checked in we did not want to leave. What sets Solage apart from other high end resorts is their attention to details: - You're provided with a drink at check in while the valet drives your car around to your cottage, followed by you and your things. - Each room is basically its own cottage complete with a private landscaped patio and beach cruisers for use to ride around the property of into calistoga - turndown service includes a jar of spring water with fresh mint leaves - each room as a drip coffee maker, with a jar of real ground coffee... (my favorite part!) - at the pool, regardless of whether you order drinks or food (we did, a lot) the attendants bring around jars of cucumber and lemon water - the showers in the room are supplied with products from the spa - The spa should get its own separate review. I love spas and have been to more than I can count, all over the country. Spa Solage is, hands down, the best spa I have ever been to... again, no detail goes unnoticed. We highly, highly recommend staying here... you will not want to leave either!

Reviews.Title: “Understatedly Elegant Resort with the Most Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: ashnwrig
Reviews.Content: We just had our wedding at Solage and spent 4 nights here. What a beautiful setting for a wedding and every staff member exudes total class and sophistication. They are so very accommodating and gracious. Our wedding was handled expertly and we highly recommend this lovely property for a Napa wedding. With the palm trees and pool setting, it is like being in the Caribbean but in wine country- the best of all both worlds! (For any St. Barts travelers, it is right up there with Hotels Guanahani and Isle de France.) Email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “...because you're worth it.”
Reviews.Author: mrwritesf
Reviews.Content: I found out about Solage as an entry on a friend's Facebook page, did a little research and decided to try it. Sure it's pricey, but as the title line says... Rooms, termed studios, are in the form of chalets/cottages/cabins and most have parking nearby so you don't have to walk far to unload / reload your car. The studios are larger than most hotel rooms and include sitting areas and a patio. The bath amenities are the hotel's own blends, the bath area includes a small dressing area near the vanity/sink, and the shower has a pebble stone floor. The bed is very comfortable with down linens and there's turndown service in the evening. I took a few treatments at the spa including the resort's signature Mudslide...and when it was over, I wanted to do it again....BLISS. The best part was the sound chair; I want one for my living room!!! :-) When you have any spa treatment, you get to use the geothermal mineral pools--a bit like soaking in a bathtub, but very relaxing and if you're lucky, you can retire to the shade of a cabana, which I don't think are reserved, unlike those at the main pool. Meals at Solbar were wonderful--don't be put off by the prices because they're worth it, particularly for dinner. I had short ribs for dinner one night and then short ribs hash for breakfast the next day...they were just THAT good!!!! I didn't have lunch at Solbar because you can order food while lounging around their BEAUTIFUL olympic sized pool. Here's where the prices seem high--$7 for fries and no mixed drink under $10. Still, it's worth it, even though they tack on a 20% service charge, just like room service. KILLER fish tacos, by the way!!!!!!!!! As for the personnel, the staff were all very attentive seemed happy in their jobs, despite spending a lot of time in the hot sun. If there's one detractor, it's that the grounds seem to belie the location. In the rich fertile Napa Valley, the grounds of Solage look very arid and prairie-like; lots of brush with patches of manicured lawns with water features, numerous geckos scurrying across your path, and very little shade. However, some of that brush include lavender plants and honeysuckle bushes and when the breeze carries their scent, you somehow don't mind the lack of greenery. Given the price tag, you might think you'd be surrounded by a bunch of A-list money'd "beautiful people", but it's surprisingly not like that. It's very mixed crowd that includes young couples, families, and small groups of friends, most of whom haven't stepped out of the pages of "Town and Country" and don't have gym-toned bodies. Oh...and I did see a handful of same-sex couples who seemed to be very welcome there. Go ahead...indulge. You'll be glad you did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Messages”
Reviews.Author: maspeek
