Reviews.Content: Solage is an Auberge property which means it is incredibly high end yet unpretentious. Everything was perfect during our stay; we can't find anything wrong at this wonderful resort. * The property has everything you could want: two pools (adult and kids) with Calistoga's famous mineral water (food and beverage service, towels, water and private cabanas); beautiful and pampering spa; bright well equiped gym, yoga studio, complimentary exercise classes and complimentary bikes to cruise the neraby town and/or wineries; and best of all an outstanding restaurant. * Each stand alone cottage has an outdoor private patio, wonderful bath products, mini frig, coffee maker, utensils and wifi. They are large inside, "green" in design and very bright. You don't want to leave your cottage! * The staff is young, friendly and helpful. Everyone seems happy to work here. * The restaurant is unbelievable. We are from San Francisco area and used to excellent food, but this place still stands out. The food is unbelievably fresh - mostly grown nearby - and creatively delicious with nice portions. The Chef stopped by each table the evening we dined. We had breakfast and dinner and loved every item. * The location is ideal. You can walk/bike 5 minutes to the quaint town of Calistoga; hiking is across the street; numerous wineries abound, but lounging by the gorgeous pool sipping a beverage and enjoying a good book is also right there. We are already planning a return trip in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: bijlee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight on a spontaneous romantic getaway. What an incredible experience! I was not aware when I booked our stay that this resort had made #11 on Travel & Leisure's Top 50. Quite an accomplishment for a barely two year old property! The staff here makes you feel welcome the moment you arrive with a glass of fresh lemonade and an amazingly friendly demeanor. They are a green property, but that does not mean any kind of compromise on luxury...the rooms are cool and lovely- separate cabins with private patios, and the free bikes outside are a nice touch. The spa is abs. fabulous- we had the three step mud treatment in a couples room and a couples massage afterwards. Heaven!! Unfortunately we didn't get the chance to try out the all- mineral water pool inside the spa, though it was invitingly heated at a nice 90 degrees. We dined at Solbar and everyone was aware ahead of time that I was a vegetarian and bent over backwards to accomodate me. The chef (who was a sous chef at French Laundry prior to this) came out personally to ask if chicken broth was okay with me. The food and wine were to die for! The concierge not only promptly sent over information for a hot air balloon ride which I had requested, but a long handwritten note with all the relevant particulars. He seamlessly assisted with getting the reservations done with less than half a day's notice. At every touch point, we encountered unbelievably friendly and helpful service. We were barely there 24 hours, but will have memories for a lifetime...

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Modern Design, Eco-Friendly, and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: spa_connaisseur
Reviews.Content: Just had a fabulous stay at Solage. What a unique place! A great modern design boutique resort and spa near near downtown Calistoga. LOVE the luxurious modern design of the rooms, very high end, love the concrete floors. Each cottage has their own little patio with lounge chairs, we spent a lot of time hanging out on the patio overlooking beautiful old oak trees. It felt very private. They have three pools, one is a mineral pool in the bathhouse by the spa, which was my favorite, and then a larger pool and a family pool over by the restaurant. Great workout facility, one of the best I have seen, even though I never actually used it, I liked knowing it was there just in case..... Also had a beautiful yoga studio next to the gym. Food was really amazing at Solbar. Unique very fresh California cuisine, and great atmosphere on outdoor lounge / patio and fire-pit. The restaurant also serves filtered water which I loved and so appreciate. They have cruiser bikes at every cottage, so you can cruise around town or the resort. Love that. They also allow dogs, we brought our two little Chihuahuas and they loved it. So nice to go on vacation and not have to leave them behind! I am a total purist when it comes to bath products, and Solage actually has really pure bath products in the rooms made by Sumbody - a great company. I travel a lot and can not think of a single time when I have ever used the products in hotel rooms because most are full of chemicals and preservatives. I always bring my own. I was so pleasantly surprised and to be honest a little shocked when I saw that they are using "Sumbody" products in the rooms and they really are actually all natural and pure. I am so impressed by the "little things" and Solage doesn't' miss a beat on those great little extravagant details. The spa also has an organic all natural line of facial products called Eminence, my absolute favorite skin care line ever. I usually don't get facials at resorts because most have products that are full of chemicals. Solage is definitely the most eco-frinedly resort I have been too. They have countless green aspects, one of my favorites was that instead of bringing plastic bottles of water to your room at night, they leave you a complimentary beautiful reusable glass bottle of filtered water with a beautiful sprig of mint in it for turn down service. Great touch, and I highly commend them for doing away with the plastic bottles, what a great idea. First resort I have stayed at that does this. That alone makes me want to go back. Had two fabulous massages while I was there at the spa and we also did the couples mud slide experience, which I highly recommend. Pure heaven. Just writing about it makes me want to go back. I have stayed at a lot of different places in Napa/ Sonoma/ Calistoga/ Wine Country and Solage (and Calistoga Ranch) are my two favorites, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Libs007
Reviews.Content: We went to the Solage Calistoga for our anniversary and stayed for two nights. The resort was wonderful. Each room is a separate bungalow with its own patio, gas fireplace, garden tub and two cruiser bikes parked outside. The rooms are very modern and plush. They are definitely not your standard luxury hotel rooms - they have special touches such as all of the green features, natural rock open shower, their own line of bath products (including a bath bomb for the garden tub) and fun/local items in the mini bar. We loved the bikes and cruised all around the property and even biked into town (Calistoga) for dinner one night. We found a package that included breakfast - and breakfast was wonderful! We enjoyed the two pools (one for kids and one adults only) as well as the mineral spa. I had a manicure/pedicure in their spa which was wonderful. They also have great fitness facilities - one room with state of the art equipment and another with a yoga/spinning studio. The fitness classes are included and I took a spinning class one morning that was really great. The resort was also very knowledgeable and helpful in scheduling tours to the local vineyards/wineries. They were able to get us into an appointment only winery (Quintessa) and waived the normal tour/tasting fee (which was $45/pp). My husband and I have stayed in very nice places before but think that the Solage was probably, overall, one of our favorite places. We would definitely go back and would definitely recommend it for anyone who wants a relaxing weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: jeffslove
Reviews.Content: The stay was wonderful. The staff was very helpful by going above and beyond the call of duty to make us happy. The fitness instructor was awesome and the workout facility is top notch. The food in the restaurant is truly yummy and we even saw a celebrity at dinner. The Solage provides 2 bikes with every room and I felt like a 12 year old kid again on the bikes! The hotel, the staff and the food was absolutely divine, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chrisb321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solage for one night during our Napa trip. Why only one night? Well the normal rates are $350 and up and we were not prepared to pay that much but I was able to use my free stay from the hotels.com program which allowed us to get the room for just the tax. We paid $31 a night for the Solage !!! Awesome !! The resort is just wonderful. The room was fantastic. A very modern studio with concrete flooring, fantastic walk in shower and beautiful patio. We used the complimentary beach cruiser bikes to get into the town (about half a mile away) for dinner and drinks that evening. The pool was wonderful and totally deserted. Not sure where everyone was. The reviews for this place are good for a reason and if you can get a night for $31 then do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: We've been visiting the wine country for years now and have stayed at various different places, but after our last visit to Solage, this is now our favorite. Each spacious room/unit is detached with plenty of privacy, private outdoor patio with serene views, wonderful bathrooms, access to our own bicycles and excellent service. This is truly a wonderful place with amazing vws, huge pool, nice restaurant and ideal location. For the price, I'd say it's the best in all of the valley. Book your stay and you'll be extremely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Pampering in a Serene Setting”
Reviews.Author: MaryCFP
Reviews.Content: Staff has one up on the Disney hospitality, with exceptional care for the guests as well as the property. Indulge in spa, mineral bath, or excellent restaurant. Or, breakfast in bed delivered via bike, in this eco-friendly lodge. We biked into town for lunch, but warning - Calistoga is plain Jane next to St. Helena. Rather refreshing. Good Bed, pillows and quiet are something we expect, but our expectations were exceeded. We did ask for a room away from the pools are were glad, because families with kids do visit. Yoga class on Sun morn was crowded - get there early. Would have liked a computer/printer to print out boarding passes, but the front desk helped out in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely New Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBitten99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary getaway. We took our 3 year old son. The grounds and the cottages are very, very nice. I read nearly all the reviews prior to booking our reservations. I noticed that most of the negative reviews were from the resort's first guests when it opened nearly 2 years ago. Now that the landscape has matured somewhat and the staff and service have been fine-tuned, I think many of those who were dismayed with their stay would find a different experience altogether if they were to give it another chance. It is a mite on the pricey side but there are definitely a lot of perks to staying here. Besides the gorgeous grounds, facilities and attentive staff, they supply complimentary cruisers, free wifi, iPod dock, and porches with each cottage. The food was good although, again, pricey. We didn't use the spa, opting for something more affordable at Lavender Hill. The gym is very nice. Our son loved the kiddie pool and the bocce courts and just wandering around the grounds. It's a really beautiful place and perfect for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: CBA1
Reviews.Content: The staff at Solage Calistoga is excellent. I started my visit with a deep tissue massage at the Spa and follow that up with a relaxing dip in the hot mineral pool. After my dip in the mineral pool, I had the most delectable shrimp and lettuce wraps at Solbar. After lunch I had the most wonderful facial ever ! I can't say enough about the staff at the Spa, they are very professional and knowIedgable about their individual craft. They never kept me or my friends waiting. The spa facilities are cozy and relaxing. When I returned to my room I was able to have a relaxing moment on my private patio. I had a large eco-friendly room and the bed was very comfortable. I really like the fact that they had a top-notched gym on the property, however, I only visited the gym, I did not work out. I also like the idea of riding bicycles on and off the property.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: The Solage is definitely an upscale resort, yet the atmosphere is relaxed and casual. We loved both the rooms and the grounds. The pool is beautiful, the fitness room is large with state of the art equipment. It is close to the main street of Calistoga. We enjoyed riding the bicycles (2 are provided for each room) through town. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and you must eat at the Solbar as well!”
Reviews.Author: Gate
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time at Solage! We arrived super late one night after hitting traffic coming out of SF. We were saying silent prayers the whole way up hoping they were still serving dinner as we were starved! We got there around 9PM, and greeted by a wonderful receptionist who alerted the kitchen we were coming! We had the most spectacular meal at their bistro, the Solbar...truly the best of our trip (separate review). The room was super comfortable and we had a heavenly night’s sleep. The fireplace warmed us up wonderfully. My husband was delighted with the fact that you could make your own strength coffee (they provide the coffee grounds versus prepackaged amounts). I loved the Sumbody amenities and ended up buying them at the Spa to give my best friend for her birthday. I wished we had stayed longer to use the bicycles, but what a lovely touch! We did stay for breakfast the next morning which we have to say was the absolute highlight of the entire trip (another separate review). All I will say is try the made to order cinnamon sugar donuts - oh my goodness! This is a gem of a hotel and we will definitely be coming back with friends to visit the wineries surrounding the area. This is a much better location than staying in Napa. We had stayed at the Carneros Inn the week before and we definitely prefer Solage.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LANDG75
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we felt relaxed. Sadly we only stayed for two nights but the room (each is a separate single storey bungalow), food, surrounding and facilities where perfect. Bikes are supplied and once you have mastered no brakes/pedding backwards to stop they are great fun. The Sterling vineyard is in walking/cycling distance and worth a visit. The main town was a little disappointing and, if you stay for a few days, you might find your choice of eating limited - but if you just want to get away from it all - this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Trip”
Reviews.Author: travelsomeday2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My husband and I went to Calistoga for Valentines weekend this year and enjoyed every minute. Solage has great bungalow type rooms that makes it feel like it's your own little house. We had huge windows looking out onto a beautiful garden area. The room decoration is very modern and minimalist but it's exactly what we like. The spa and mud treatments were awesome and the mineral pool was wonderful. We even took advantage of some yoga classes. To top it all off it rained the whole weekend but we didn't really mind! It was a blast and we were lucky enough to get some rainbow views after the rain cleared. We will definitely return and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Check you Bill!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GregRI
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a wonderful two night stay at Solage. The rooms are very nice and everything seemed great. I just got done wasting my time trying to figure out why I was overcharged 400$. For some reason hotels.com charged me and Solage charged me for my room, so I was charged twice. Called hotels.com and they told me it was a mistake on Solage's end, and hotels.com took care of the details of the dispute. Now I have to wait another two weeks before I get the 400$ back. My biggest problem with this is what if I had not checked into this matter? Would they have called me 2 months from now and said we were going over our records and we found a mistake, very doubtful. This incident has left a bad taste in my mouth, if I go back to the Napa area I will look to stay at another hotel, the way in which they handled this matter was very unprofessional. Make sure you check your bill over a couple times when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not deserving of price”
Reviews.Author: txserin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2008. Its a nice property, but does not warrant the prices. It seemed like they were going for the 4 seasons type price; but the service and accommodations do not stack up. The hotel wasnt bad by any means, and neither were the staff. However, it just lacked that 4+ star touch. The property is very nicely landscaped, and the bungalow approach is nice and allows for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in the Napa Valley for the picky traveler”
Reviews.Author: Bryan45
Reviews.Content: I visit the Napa Valley almost every other week as my wife and I are quite the wine collectors and lovers. We have stayed at all the better hotels in the Napa area. I wanted to stay for a night and not spend $500+ for an acceptable hotel. This was the first that we had stayed at Solage and I love this place; it is new and hip while not in an overcrowded part of the valley. The valet service was nice and very helpful, front desk personel were great and we chose the smallest room ,which was still quite large, everything was new and modern with a very nice patio as the room was a duplex cottage. The room was very tastfully decorated with large bath and rain type shower. Unit comes with 2 cruiser type bike for your use-- very nice-- spa was also fab. if you know napa you will know that as of this time Solage is the best deal for premium hotel and in a quiet part of the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: cpgteg
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to stay at some great hotels around the world. Some hotels live up to their billing (e.g., Raffles Beverly Hills; the Four Seasons at Whistler; the Four Seasons Aviara; the Park Hyatt in Chicago; Sandy Lane in Barbados; the Ritz-Carlton in Berlin); others fall short (e.g., Four Seasons Chicago); and still others exceed expectations (e.g., Conrad Indianapolis; Glasshouse in Edinburgh; Sofitel New York; Renaissance Chancery Court in London). The Solage Calistoga falls into this latter group. The Solage is easily among our top 10 or 20 favorite hotels/resorts. We stayed in a King Studio. This room, which we assume is representative of others of its type, is beatifully designed (contemporary styling with original art) and very comfortable (open, high ceilings, great bed, and perhaps the best shower we've encountered in a hotel/resort). The customer service, grounds, and restaurant (Solbar) are also first-rate. We can't recommend this place highly enough. Perhaps its only downside is that it's in Calistoga, which is several miles north of the heart of Napa Valley (e.g., all of the great restaurants in Yountville, including The French Laundry).

Reviews.Title: “Flying visit to Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: lwilliams75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as part of a 7 day tour of Northern California. I thought the service was great. We were greeted warmly at reception and wished a happy 1st anniversary. We asked about wineries to visit, and was given helpful advice from two different members of staff. When we checked out, the same woman served us and asked if we enjoyed our winery visits from the day before. Our room was excellent. I was worried that I would think the decor was too 'cold' due to being so modern - but that was not the case at all. I liked the concrete floors. We stayed in an Adara studio and it was great. The fireplace in the room kicked out heat. The bathroom area was lovely and I didnt want to get out of the walk in shower! The robes provided are also awesome - really thick and soft. Our room overlooked a small oak grove which was nice. I liked the touch of having the bikes available to use although we didnt get a chance to use them. We also didnt eat at the hotel - we ate in downtown Calistoga which is very close and left early the next day to drive to Yosemite Park. This was the most expenisve hotel we stayed at at $400 + tax for one night. We stayed at two Ritz Carlton hotels during the same trip. I think this is a little on the expensive side, but the rooms and service were excellent. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Group treated well by Solage”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan3
Reviews.Content: Over 60 employees were accomodated for two nights for a corporate meeting. At first, I was skeptical considering some of the negative comments from privacy issues to "their house rules", however the property did a fantastic job in servicing our conference. Before check-in and even before the official meeting commenced the next morning, I was allowed for no extra charge to use the Luna room to have a staff meeting with 4 people. Although relatively a new property, the staff is dedicated and committed to high service from check in through check out. Although the rooms are energy efficient and quite modern emphasing green (carbon footprint reductions), the detached rooms/townhomes are very private - unless you decide to sit outside on your patio, as their are still new plantings that will take a while to create privacy spaces. The only criticism of the room is the heat registers are in the ceiling and do not get the heat down to the floor level as good as could be. The room and bathroom/shower consequently were never toasty especially when it was 32 degrees outside in December in early morning. The service during the conference, such as water, coffee, muffins and even the breakfast was good and attention to detail was noted. Overall all employees we encountered were extremely polite. If you are planning a group meeting/conference , Solage is the way to go- especially when out of towners are part of the group. You are within 10- 15 minutes of St. Helena, Rutherford and very close to Lincoln Ave in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: hseikaly
Reviews.Content: Went there with my girlfriend for a nice romantic, relaxing getaway and this place hit the spot. Check in was very smooth. Our studio was impeccable, clean, and fit our modern style just right. We got the couples mudslide treatment along with couples massages and both were excellent. Definitely recommend the mudslide if you haven't tried it as its an interesting and fun experience. The food at the SolBar was very good and a nice end to the spa day. The staff was very friendly and helpful, directing us to local wineries and also allowing us to use the bathhouse on the day we didn't have a treatment. All and all, an amazing weekend and we plan to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management! They actually stole my money!”
Reviews.Author: BigDillSmack
Reviews.Content: This is not a joke, I was having a pleasant time with friends at a gathering and wine tasting at Solage, when the two managers actually stole over $300 in cash right off of my table! They claimed no knowledge of this and asked me to leave. When questioned further they claimed the cash was theirs. I work hard for my money and to have it taken away like that is almost like stealing - oh wait, it IS stealing!!!! I will never stay or attend a party at this location again! For any tourists, visitors, or wine connoisseurs, this is a place to steer clear of.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, California Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jkb_8
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a GREAT weekend at Solage - it was perfect!! I had read many reviews and did quite a bit of research for the napa region and was so happy with our choice. We went for a long weekend and loved the location - a little off the beaten path yet close to many great vineyards. The staff was young, hip and helpful. The food was so delicious - we had breakfast and dinner. Pool/spa/mineral pools were great and the fitness area was clean with many machines, etc... I also went for a nice long run and my husband and I did a great hike about 2 minutes away. Honestly, I can't find anything wrong with it - can't wait to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, refreshed & revived !”
Reviews.Author: RSands
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay in Solage. Food was definitely some of the best I have ever eaten. Staff were very attentive and the Mud experience was so relaxing. I loved having the bicycles and cycling into Calistoga. I would definitely recommend this resort for a total relaxation holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Solage was a fantastic retreat”
Reviews.Author: DocGTE
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at this resort. The service was truly impeccable from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The staff were very friendly, serviced our every need, and did it all quickly and with a smile. The spa, meals, and room were all top notch. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The location is outstanding. We loved every minute and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Spa/Resort”
Reviews.Author: DavidCOttawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three week nights at Solage Calistoga. Physically, Solage Calistoga is a very new resort. On the one hand this meant that everything in the resort was brand new with all the attributes that entails. On the other hand, most of the vegetation is young and somewhat sparse looking. I am sure in a few seasons, the look of the resort will improve as the vegetation matures. Our room/Cabin was fantastic - the bed was great; the bathroom was luxurious. The rooms are tastefully decorated. The restaurant - Solbar- located at the resort was excellent; in fact it was so good that we ate there two out of three nights during our stay, thereby allowing both my wife and I the indulgence of sharing a bottle of wine and not having to drive (the third night we ate at the excellent restaurant 'Cooks' in St. Helena). The food was incredibly fresh and tasty. We also had a great waiter named Moss who was super friendly and made our dining experience special. The gym equipment was all top-notch and, at least when I was there, underutilized by the other guests; I was normally the only person in the gym. The resort offers about three physical fitness activties a day (swimming, pilates, etc). My wife and I took a spinning class as well as a yoga class. Both instructers were very good. Overall, I would recommend the resort. I am not sure I would pay there top season rate but if you can go off-season the resort is a good deal for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Wedding Location!”
Reviews.Author: Bayareatraveler1539
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception April 2008 at Solage and we couldn't have been happier. Some guests told us this was the best wedding celebration they had ever attended. Our friends and family were not only were treated to a memorable wedding but it was also a great weekend getaway for all. The reasons we loved our experience at Solage are numerous - The food was the best we've ever had at a wedding, the service was spectacular, the valet crew was very helpful and the front desk provided customized directions to our guests at check-out. The rooms are modern and up-to-date with all of today’s comforts such as a plasma TV, pebbled floor shower, wireless internet, private patio and last but not least, a very comfortable bed. Make sure you take the two included cruiser bikes into town! If you have a stay on a warm weekend, you may never leave the poolside where you can enjoy drinks and food from Solbar. The gym enthusiasts certainly won’t be disappointed and the bride had a very relaxing morning on her wedding day at the spa. We have seen some reviews about the landscaping. First, the place is barely over a year old so keep in mind that the trees/shrubs need time. Solage is eco-friendly and they kept the landscaping design in mind when determining water/resource requirements to keep the place going. In fact, many of the employees bike to work or carpool to be more "green." In our opinion, the property is gorgeous and will only get better with time. In fact, there have been some new landscaping projects since our April wedding. We were so impressed we joined Club Solage and our fondness of the place continues to grow.

Reviews.Title: “pretentious and horrendous”
Reviews.Author: starfishes
Reviews.Content: I used to work in Hospitality. I now work at a company that travels a lot, and I'm lucky to stay in lovely hotels all over the world with my crew. Please don't misunderstand: these things don't make me spoiled, but well-versed. A group of 12 of us recently stayed at the hotel during a work trip. We work hard and the thought of having a nice comfortable place to stay at night was something to look forward to. we heard good things, and the property was lovely upon sight. Not at all what I expected, as it was so new and suburban feeling, almost a bit like something out of the The Truman Show, but its new, so excusable. The rooms are huge. A lot bigger than I needed. Our group of 12 was staying one week, so I didn't feel bad calling to ask if I could switch to a room with one bed vs. two, since I was alone here for 7 days, but they said they couldn't work it out so I shrugged and didn't make a thing of it. (although I found this strange because it was a Monday and the hotel seemed kind of empty). The next night, a work friend called the hotel restaurant, Bar Sol, to make a reservation for 12. She called at 5:30 for a 7:30 dinner reservation. The hostess laughed in her face, which I found unnecessary and rude. However, we are a reasonable group and I suppose it was kind of last minute, so when she told us there is no way she could fit us in, we made no deal of it and decided to meet for cocktails at the bar/restaurant first and then go into town for dinner. At this point, the group had now narrowed to 8. While we were at SolBar having cocktails, 7:30 rolled around and we realized the place was quite empty. There were over 10 tables open outside and an entire indoor eating area inside with not ONE table occupied. We asked the hostess if she could fit our group afterall, and she said she'd "work on it". (?) Even the bartender questioned what was taking so long in getting her to seat us, as he was getting slammed at the bar due to their lack of effort in finding us a proper table. About an hour and an order of appetizers in an empty restaurant later, they finally sat us down. We waited for an HOUR AND A HALF before they even brought us BREAD. two hours later, we were served food that wasn't worth the wait (maybe we were just fuming). We asked the waiter what the deal was and he answered uncomfortably, "i'm not supposed to talk about why we can't seat people here. its a weird thing that doesn't make sense" (!) We stopped prying and his manager/the hostess lady pulled him aside and we never saw him again! they had another person tend to us the rest of the meal. It was really strange and felt more like The Truman Show by the minute. Like a cult or something. The next awful event was the spa. It happened to be my birthday during my stay, and my boss generously booked me a massage our last night at the hotel. He made a 6pm reservation. I showed up at 5:30 and the girl told me to go wait in the mineral pool. It was 99 degrees outside, and I was in a robe, and the pool was pretty hot too, so I opted to sit outside the mineral pool under an oning and wait for the masseuse. 6:10 rolls around and I thought I misunderstood, so I went back to the front desk to see where she was.The girl then rudely told me that I was in the wrong area and that I was supposed to have come back inside (wrong. she did NOT tell me that. she told me the masseuse was supposed to come find me, which is the norm in spas. besides, i had not moved from where she told me to go originally). She then told me to go wait in the waiting area, which was cute, but outside. Again, I had on a robe and it was 99 degrees outside. I'm pouring sweat, and getting cranky. Its 6:30 something. I go inside to the air conditioned area in the front reception and told her I'd wait there. After a lot of squirming around up at the front desk, the manager then comes to report that they've made a mistake and can't fit me in. (I'm sure you readers must thing I either: stink, am funny looking or am some sort of whacked out maniac at this point in the story considering all of these people keep denying me service. But alas, none of this is true, i can assure you). She was trying very hard to be sugary nice and fix the problem by offering things like, "we have a male masseuse that can give you a foot rub" (I specifically wanted a female masseuse and told them this earlier in the day after my boss booked the appointment for me and told her I would not take a male in replacement of my original request, so she tried to push this weird situation about a foot massage on me). she offered to let me take a dip in their mineral pool (uh, that comes free with the service, you ain't fooling me here) and then finally, when I explained to her I had knots in my back I was looking forward to getting worked on with a proper massage and a dip in the pool wouldn't cut it as a replacement, she insisted I go to a room with this specialty NASA-built-state of the art chair which was a great massage chair and really relaxing. At this point, I"m utterly annoyed and said no thank you, but she insisted I go sit in the chair while she tried to work out my appointment. I said okay and was lead to a room with what is basically a luxury lazy-boy. it doesn't move, you lounge in it and put on earphones while they play bad hippie jazz in your earphones. I'll admit, I was in a really bad mood at this point, so maybe to some this could be relaxing, but after 2 minutes, I turned the stupid thing off, went to the bathroom, got dressed and left. I told them to call me in my room if they could fit me in soon. She chased me out the door saying they could get me in in 30 minutes. I gave in and said okay, but that I needed to call my friends, seeing as I had dinner reservations soon and I had to check to see if we could push them back. It turns out our dinner plans could not be rearranged, so I called her to express my disappointment in this situation and even added that we had a similarly bad experience at the restaurant a couple of nights before. She said I'm sorry and didn't offer any complimentary treatment on a future visit or anything in leu of . She did, however, send a candle and an apology to my room, but after all that craziness, it didn't make up for it. Although her effort was appreciated, her ideas of things (foot massage, free pool usage, weird dumb space chair, candle) as replacements for the hour massage I got screwed on, were stupid. Later, to just get the day over with, I ordered room service. The delivery girl walked right into my room upon delivering my food,even though I took the platter from her hands and insisted she didn't have to help me set it up, attempted to be chatty cathy about what was on my tv, and then later, around 10pm, might i add, came banging on my door asking for the dishes back.Literally, BANGING and yelling into my door. I was asleep. Overall, this place is so utterly pretentious. They built this huge commune, filled it with fancy rooms, a spa and a restaurant but obviously don't have the man power or knowledge of how to train their staff to be service-oriented. Nobody there asks what YOU want, how they can help YOU, but instead, treat you like you should be lucky to be there. I don't buy it. You don't build clientle by trying to trick people into thinking they are part of something good, or part of some "scene" they are trying to create, but instead, you built clientle by offering good, professional service, by working with a customer and their needs, and by stepping off your high horse. They lost a group of potentially 40 something people, for weeks at a time, every few months. THATS how bad the service was. My entire crew was talking about how bad this experience was. And even best! I didn't pay for anything! My work paid for everything and I am still just mad. I cannot IMAGINE how livid I would be if this were my own money, saved up for a vacation. Absolutely not worth it. This place needs to take some of the money they put into the extra, weird space in the room and replace it with some service training around here. Clean, comfy space is not worth such dirty attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: BCKathleen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three days at Solage to celebrate our anniversary and absolutely loved it. I had read some negative comments but had no issues with the property which is putting in beautiful lush landscaping. I loved the privacy of having our own cabin and the room was spotless. The food was delicous and the wait staff was very attentive. I had a massage and my husband a mud bath which we enjoyed. The facilities at the spa are very nice, I highly recommend using the mineral pool in the Bathhouse. The gym equipment was first rate and has a view of the moutains surrounding the property. Overall, I think it was one of the best hotels I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: walden80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two terrific nights at Solage. Room was beautiful: contemporary but comfy. There's lots of wood and stone, a wonderful bed, fireplace and covered patio. A great place to kick back and enjoy some of the wines from the vineyards just down the road. We pedaled our bikes into town but made sure we were back in time to enjor a yummy breakfast--outdoors near the gorgeous pool--both mornings. The spa, the fitness center were all first-rate. Mud slide treatment is a blast! Once we tasted the food at Solbar, we didn't eat any place else. It's just plain deliciious. Well, not really plain as the ingredients and preparations are more like what you'd find at fine dining restaurants. Gnocchi, steamed pork buns, sand dabs, desserts were all outstanding. I love Solage's design. Being from the East Coast, it feels very exotic: so open and unadorned that it's hard to know where inside ends and outside begins. We'll go again and soon.

Reviews.Title: “Solage on Silverado Trail is the ultimate relaxing destination”
Reviews.Author: JoKope
Reviews.Content: Solage has all the basic elements to become a great resort. It's almost there, but not quite. I'm reluctant to be at all negative because I had such a relaxing and enjoyable time. When you visit I think you'll see what I mean. Unlike some five star resorts this property -- perhaps because of the informality of California and the surrounding rustic ranch-like country -- is quite relaxing from the moment you drive up. It doesn't take time to unwind. I guess that someone would say the karma is good at this place. There is this wonderful setting and the quiet of the Silverado Trail backcountry. At any rate the location is superb. The main dining room has one of the most beautiful views of the mountains through a huge, two or three story window. Outdoor dining with a fire on top of a rectangular fountain is superb. The sommelier is knowledgeable and helpful with the wine selections and the concierges on which wineries to visit down the road (Joseph Phelps, Clos Pegase, etc.) if you don't have a week to visit all of the usual suspects in Napa, St. Helena and Rutherford. Architecture at Solage is simple yet extremely well-designed (contemporary) one-storey buildings with vaulting ceilings and the lastest electronics. A rather fun coffee maker. The rooms are individual houses with open rooms and private cabanas set up with exterior sofas for a drink or meals. There are bikes outside each concrete-floored cabin to get around the property or ride into nearby Calistoga. (Try Sarafornia if you want a great breakfast or lunch outside the spa menu and prices.) I found the staff quite helpful. I'd give them a top rating. From making airline bookings at midnight to information on geology, history and wines, they know a great deal. Everyone seems to be about 25 or 30 and very charming. They are very devoted to the enterprise.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if it is worth the hefty price”
Reviews.Author: Paulownia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed their with another couple for a weekend trip. I rated the place "above average" because there are some outstanding features of this hotel/spa but there are some negative features as well which makes it hard for us to decide whether we would go there again, especially given how expensive the place is. I didn't have time to read the reviews on tripadvisor (which I normally do) before our trip and I wish I had because they are quite accurate. I only had their website to go by and when we got there, we were really disappointed because the entire place looked a lot "cheaper" than what we were imagining from their brochure and website. The place is very new and the trees and shrubbery they had planted are still very young so the entire place looks very bare. The entire bareness highlights the cheap construction of the "bungalows" where visitors stay and it is too reminiscent of "summer camp" from our childhood days. With the prices were paying, we were looking for more than "summer camp." We had the most expensive unit in this hotel - a suite. Unfortunately, our suite looked onto the trailer/motor home camp which we could see easily because they didn't bother to have some tall shrubs covering this unpleasant view. We were a little disappointed that we had paid $800 a night to have an experience of staying in a summer camping ground. If you are allergic to bug bites (as we are), make sure you bring bugspray...I don't think they spray the premises (since they are very green) so we got bitten by a variety of bugs while walking around the hotel grounds. To be fair to the hotel, the inside of the suite was very nice (if you like the modern/contemporary "West Elm" look). Our bathroom was very large and we liked the fact that we each had a bathroom sink (thus we never had to fight for the bathroom mirror). Also, the toilet had a separate door which was nice. The tub was large and our suite had a separate shower which was very spacious. The cement floors were also nice on out bare feet, especially when it was 100F outside...though I can imagine they may be a little cold for winter visitors. We also had our own patio with a dining table, chairs and a hot tub..this patio area was walled off so we had complete privacy when we were outside and enjoying the hot tub. The suite may be worth it for couples and honeymooners who are looking for a romantic getaway. The view of the stars while relaxing in the hot tub at night was quite incredible. Other pros - the restaurant bar has excellent food... everything we ordered on the menu was delicious...hotel staff members are friendly, unpretentious and helpful. The spa was excellent too - my friends and I had massages which were incredible and they are highly recommended. Still, next time I am in that area I may opt to stay at another hotel for less and just pay for use of their spa treatment and mineral pool.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Wes40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Solage Calistoga this past weekend for 3 nights. My partner and I needed to get out of the city. We had seen all the press on Solage so we booked and are so happy we did. We have been going to Napa Valley for a few years, now we have found a resort we can truly say, "we love everything about it." The staff we the amongst the best I've encountered in my travels.What really was refreshing to us is they really wanted to help us and cared about the experience we we having. The restaurant and spa were excellent. The rooms were comfortable but modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Trackers
Reviews.Content: I went to Solage with a girlfriend - for a week of relaxing, visiting vineyards and a bit of exercise. The resort is very new and as some of the reviews say you can see that it will really come into it's own when the planting develops but it's still very pretty. Everyone gets their own little cottage - ours comprised of a large bedroom/livingroom with two double beds and a very large shower room. The whole resort has a very contemporary feel to it. Outside your cottage you each get a nice seating area and a couple of bikes - it took me a while to get on mine but they're great fun and really safe. It's the only place in America where I've seen cycle lanes so worth getting out and about. The pool is amazing - a proper sports pool where you could do length after length and loads of loungers/umbrellas. The staff are really attentive and come round all the time with water/drinks etc. The restaurant/bar is set near the pool with a large comfy area to sit outside - most people take breakfast here. My only complaint would be how limited the menus were and they didn't change all week. The staff were very helpful (though sometimes overwhelmed at breakfast). The concierge was great at making bookings at the vineyards and reastaurants for us. The spa looks great but I found the choices fairly boring and I wasn't that impressed with my facial (this was part of a treatment which included a wrap and massage - had to move from the facial room to the massage room which was a bit of pain) and my mini pedicure was poor. OK but I've had better. The gym was well equipped and light and airy which was nice but pretty crammed. Eg if you like doing floor work wasn't much room cos of all the machines. They have a studio and I got to try the pilates machines but they only had 2/3 classes over the whole week. The resort is about a 10 minute walk from Calistoga which is a cute old town with a few nice shops and restaurants - but don't expect much night life. We pretty much went to out to other places in the evening as the area has so many great restaurants on offer. Calistoga is a good half hour north of Napa but I think a much prettier area and good for many of the great vineyards in both Napa and Sonoma. Would stay here again but if the budget afforded it would like to try their sister hotel Auberge de Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “So Lovely at Solage”
Reviews.Author: BayandBeyond
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing change for Napa Valley. Solage Calisoga is totally unpretentious but still delivers on all the best things you love about wine country. I enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner at Solbar and the cusine was fresh, flavorful and delicious each time. The spacious indoor/outdoor environment offers great choices for al fresco dining overlooking the beautiful pool and mountains or a hip, clubby atmosphere inside the restaurant. The other major attraction to the property is the spa. There's an incredible gym with all the latest equipment and a spacious yoga studio where daily classes like yoga and pilates are held. Don't miss a stop at the Bath House where you can get a fun and rejuvinating Mudslide treatment (you have to experience it for yourself) and then soak in the geo-thermal pools. The price is right on compared to other facilities I've experiened in Napa Valley. I'm definitely hooked.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Anon1927
Reviews.Content: This resort was a wonderful place to stay for a relaxing weekend. We stayed in an Adara king studio that had a bath and pebble floored shower. Our studio and the neighbouring studio were in the same building but there were no connecting walls as there was an electrical/maintanence room in between the rooms. We heard absolutely nothing from our neighbours whilst we were there - we could easily have believe we were the only people staying at the resort it was so peaceful. We ate dinner at SolBar one night and it was good but nothing special and quite pricey. The breakfast was delicious though - but service was slow (nearly one hour for breakfast). The bikes are a great touch and you can pedal to downtown Calistoga in just a few minutes. We had a nice meal in the Italian restaurant there (I think it was called Bosko's) The spa treatments were good - we went for the couples mudslide. For what it was though, it was incredibly expensive but we were expecting the high prices after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. This place definitely attracts the upscale crowd with their designer clothes and fancy cars. We had a great time people watching! The staff are not at all snooty though, so don't worry if you are not the designer type (we're not!). The green theme is good - solar panels on some buidlings, rooms cleaned with "green" products, drought resistant landscaping. If you are after lush landscaping then this is not the place for you. Also, it looked like they were putting up apartments at the back of our studio so not sure what the contruction noise will be like as the project progresses (we were not bothered by it but we were there over a weekend so it was quiet).

Reviews.Title: “A Cry For Help - Diamond In The Rough”
Reviews.Author: zingrower
Reviews.Content: This review is written as a cry for help to the management of Solage Calistoga, and in particular, the management of the Auberge Group. Please improve the service at this hotel. The hotel is a diamond in the rough and has many favorable attributes. It is in a superb location, the design is excellent, and the food is quote good; however, the service is mediocre at best and significantly detracts from the guest experience. We are blessed to have travelled extensively and have stayed in numerous "luxury" hotels (including several Auberge Group hotels). We presume that many if not all of the guests at Solage have experienced other "luxury" hotels and know first hand the type of service that should accompany a $500/minumum per night room rate. We ask the hotel management to explain the following: 1. Why didn't you mow the waist high weeds that fronted the patio to our room (or at least install a screen if you were unable to mow them)? 2. Why did the restaurant "run out" of black tea on a weekend? Why couldn't someone from the hotel quickly run to Cala Food in Calistoga and purchase a box of Lipton for the enjoyment of guests who wanted a cup of tea for breakfast on a Sunday morning (desperate measures for desperate times). 3. Why was our salt grinder filled with pepper in the restaurant? I could go on, but I think the above is illustrative of the issues that plague this hotel. Yes, its the little things that keep guests coming back. We own property in Calistoga and welcome with open arms a "luxury" hotel, but reputations and return guests must be earned. Solage Calistoga continues to provide "uneven" service even 1 year after its opening. This is a shame as much of the staff provide good-excellent service, but the careless or poorly trained staff are ruining it for everyone else. I can hear Solage's management defending themselves now by complaining about the unavailability of good staff. That dog won't hunt as your competitors are not plagued by the same level of poor service. If they can do it, why can't you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Napa99
Reviews.Content: This place has the worst customer service I've seen for a $500 per night room. For example, I slept in on Saturday morning, and arrived at the restaurant for breakfast at 11:05 am. The waiter handed me a lunch menu (which is the same as the lounge menu, the same as the dinner menu with only a handful of selections of heavy foods--isn't this a spa resort?). I let him know that I just wanted some breakfast, and they could not accommodate a simple request for scrambled eggs. I expect McDonald's to turn me away from an Egg McMuffin after 11 am, but one of the more exclusive resorts in Napa? Huh? Stay at Meadowood instead.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: brianaf81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for our 15-year honeymoon. I have been to Napa, notably Calistoga four times before and have visited a few of the other spas while there before also. Starting with the room, it is well done, a very modern feel. The view out of my particular studio was not enjoyable, a mixture of tall overgrown grass and trailer homes. The two turndown services are a nice compliment but certainly do not merit the overpriced studio rates. The spa is nice and I would recommend it, though to swim in the warm pool within the spa, one has to either have a treatment done that day or pay $25. Or you can just sneak in and swim regardless, as I did for two days. The restaurant is very nice, prices are a bit high but you get what you pay for in terms of quality and freshness. The service was mediocre, almost borderline snobbish for a $230 tab. I was charge for something in the mini-bar that my wife nor I consumed. Later, after I disputed the charge it was taken off. Overall the atmosphere is very nice and being that it is less than a year old, very clean. I certainly would not stay there again, as there are many other place of great quality in Calistoga, but the concept of semi-individual studios and a great spa certainly does make it an appealing place to say you stayed there once.

Reviews.Title: “Design was great, but Service was poor...”
Reviews.Author: HonstTraveler
Reviews.Content: "We just stayed at the Solage and found the experience good and bad... Design of the resort is great - modern, hip, 'green' and natural. Inside the rooms or 'studios' as they call them, the space and decor is modern and the bathroom and showers are great. Attracts a hip, upscale crowd as we saw a nice porsche in the valet, but it later displaced by a new ferrari. Service is hit or miss - some employees are great, others seem to be brought in from the high school with no training. We waited 45 minutes for a sandwich at the pool, when there were only 8 other people there... We got a nice message saying the maid service was unable to clean because we had our 'do not disturb' sign and to call to have our room cleaned. When may wife called they gave her attitude and almost refused to have it cleaned! Design: 5 stars Service -2 stars to get to 3 stars overall"

Reviews.Title: “Unique lodging, very pleased”
Reviews.Author: soljc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Solage while wine tasting in Napa. I booked a studio several weeks in advance directly with the property, and found a cheaper rate on their website a week before my arrival, so called up and they adjusted the rate without a fuss. The property is very unique. It consists of a bunch of single level "apartments" set in a cul-de-sac style complex. My unit was joined with one other, but otherwise the units are separated (didn't hear any noise from my neighbors). The patio area has 2 seats, but no privacy so you end up looking at other patio areas (some units did have a fence for privacy). Some grass would be a welcome addition, but I didn't mind all the gravel and brown sand. As others have noted, inside the floors are concrete with the exception of a small area rug beneath the bed, so I'd encourage guests to bring flip flops for use in the apartment (they do provide a complimentary pair of slippers). The pebble shower was fantastic, and the sink/bathroom areas were simple and clean. Bed was comfy, breakfast at their restaurant was good, and the staff was friendly. Had a couples mud bath at their spa, which basically involved spreading mud on each other and baking in a room for 20 minutes, followed by a soak in a mineral bath and 20 minutes in a vibrating chair with headphones and relaxing music. Mud baking was just ok, but I enjoyed the soak and the chair. When I return, I'll opt for a bigger unit next time, mostly because of the fact the bed sits several feet from both the main door and the sliding glass door. I believe larger units have a wall separating the bed from the living area, and as mentioned above, I think some have a fence for privacy on the patio. All in all, a good stay and launching spot for some wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: plannersteph
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at Solage Calistoga, and for all intents and purposes, it is a great resort. It just opened last July, and the landscaping is drought-resistent, meaning sparse, but I am told they are going to invest in the landscaping to make it more aesthetically pleasing. The food was great, although a bit slow for breakfast, even though the dining room was empty. The bed was wonderful, and I loved the pebble stone shower floor. Our room did not have a tub, which was a bit confusing since they promote themselves as a hiking-biking-walking resort that you come back to your room and relax. The spa was fantastic, and being able to bike into Calistoga is a huge plus. Overall, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the making! Auberge makes the best!”
Reviews.Author: CleanAir8
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Napa Valley, Calistoga is One of a kind, best wines,food and best spas. Calistoga is well known for the uninque spa treatments that are offered in the area. Solage Calistoga from the creators Of Auberge they know how to make their properties be the best. Checking in was smooth as can be starting from the friendly bell men offering a glass of lemonade, not even some of the other top resorts in area do that!!! The Front desk was helpful and very comforting. The room was great really modern, the feeling was very fresh and peaceful. The pebble shower was exellent the feeling of the pebbles on your feat was relaxing. The cruisers that came with the room were great especially being close to town about 5 min ride, we biked over to downtown calistoga to do some shoppoing and grabbed a small bite to eat. From a long out in town we had spa treatments late on in the day that were out of this world. They were some of the best spa treatment i have ever had. With their signature treatment the mud slide i highly recommend it to everyone! The mineral pools were Wow!!. Later that the day we went back to our room got ready to have some dinner at Solbar, which is the restaurant on property. Had a bellmen pick us up in the golf cart had a relaxing ride over to the restaurant and the view from the restaurant over to the pool was awesome Sitting in the outside patio next to a fireburning fountain the atmosphere was great. The food was very good. I see now why SolBar was voted the BEST NEW Restaurant in the valley!. But i cant wait to come back and stay here, Just like other Auberge places they made this place just as great!!

Reviews.Title: “A Trendy Chic Stay in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: My husand and I just finished a 5 night stay at the Solage Spa in Calistoga. Overall our experience was excellent. The resort does have a "tract home" look, but don't hold that against it. We think it is trying for a trendy, chic, perhaps somewhat South Beach feel with unusual outdoor fireplaces, fountains and seating areas that give a laid back, zen-like experience. Staff is efficient and friendly. Check-in process was smooth and enjoyable. Rooms are well appointed. We stayed in the Vega Suite four of the nights. It doesn't have a fireplace or tub. but does have a bench area in the bathroom which we liked. (We spent one night in the Adara Suite which does have tub and FP. The shower is twice the size in the Adara Suite vs. the Vega Suite) The rooms have concrete floors which are cold when it is below 60 outside. All suites have a patio area and 2 cruiser bikes. Beds are comfy, great pillows and excellent overhead lighting for reading or computer time. The in -room coffee is the most delicious we have ever had. A separate tea pot is also offered. The spa is very nice. We had 2 massages each and I had a manicure/pedicure and facial. All services were excellent and the treatment rooms were warm and quiet. The locker rooms however are somewhat lacking. The upper lockers in the women's side are so high you would have to be a giant to reach the hooks to hang your clothes. It is not evident where to place your used robes and slippers when you are done. ( not near lockers or sink area) The food at the Solbar ( only restaurant on site) is delicious no matter which meal you choose to have. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner and the menus were varied with interesting choices, and the wait-staff was friendly and attentive. Wireless connection was the most painless we have ever encounted at a hotel or resort and FREE. We have traveled extensively all over the US and have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels. Solage at Calistoga compares favorably. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “getting there”
Reviews.Author: retiredincyprus
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hotel after quitting the noisy River Inn at Napa and drove a reasonable bargain $275 per night.The rooms are at least self contained and quiet but I have to agree with other travellers that in winter the concrete floors are just too damned cold.The resort and rooms are quite luxurious and we stayed happily for 5 nights enjoying Calistoga and the area, the food in Solage was not particularly good on the one night we ate there so we ate in the town and the spa at the resort was so expensive it took our breath away and we aint poor.We walked Mt.St. Helena which was a glorious experience and particularly enjoyed the eating out at Brannons with the music of Herb and his colleagues unmissable.We will return but won't use the spa unless they ameliorate their pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this newish Calistoga resort”
Reviews.Author: patches440
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 2 night stay at Solage resort in Calistoga. I would def. return. We went knowing relatively nothing about the place - no recommendations from anyone, at least. First impressions not great. At first glance, it looked like a housing tract. "Oh no, we're staying there?" Impressions quickly changed. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and helpful. The tract housing look was an eco friendly thing. Lots of olive trees and drought tolerant plants. Also, the resort is less than a year old. Plants may not be fully grown in yet. Resort consists of individual bungalows with 2 beach cruiser bikes provided for getting around or taking into town. The town of Calistoga is a very quick bike ride away. Interior of the rooms were very nice with individual patios and comfy beds. The restaurant on-site named Solbar was very good. We had a delicious dinner and breakfast. My husband and I took advantage of the Fitness package that included a massage. The spa was new and very nice. I also took a yoga class that was included in the stay. This resort is part of the high end Auberge chain and although I'm sure their other resorts in the area are nicer (I know they are more expensive) I think Solage is a good bargain. We never quite got over the starkness of the place, however, we would def. go again.

Reviews.Title: “Creative, fun and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: ArwenUndomiel
Reviews.Content: This gem of a getaway was absolutely amazing in the detail of the property and the "fun factor." From the cozy gas fireplaces to the cute bikes for every room to the calming, sophisticated spa, someone had obviously given a great deal of thought to creating an exceptional guest experience. The grounds have a slight feeling of being in Southern California by day, since the clean landscaping focuses on grasses rather than lawns. However, by night, it was completely charming to be serenaded by a chorus of chirping frogs living in the creek that winds its way through the resort. SolBar, the restaurant, was outstanding - we couldn't embellish enough about the excellent culinary experience. We can't wait to return and will recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: lichen86
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews here on tripadvisor but I had some acquaintances who stayed and loved Solage so my girlfriend and I gave it a go. We stayed in the basic room and we were able to bring our dog with us (extra $75 fee). We also made reservations in the restaurant for their 4 course prefix dinner with wine pairings, as well as a massage and their mudslide treatment at their spa. Everything was exactly in order when we arrived, the front desk was extremely friendly and we were in our room in no time. Since we had our dog, a dog bed and food/water dishes were provided in the room for him which was great. The decor and design of the room was excellent, I loved the roomy shower with pebble floor. All the amenities are top of the line, you get a LCD HDTV and DVD player, iPod dock, wifi, a very nice coffee maker with real ground coffee and high quality soaps and shampoos. The bed was excellent except a little sagging on each side from wear. The restaurant was excellent. The service was friendly and extremely attentive. The duck confit and short ribs were to die for! We slept very well, it was very peaceful and quiet. We preordered breakfast via room service for the following morning and it arrived exactly on time. The food was very good. We then made our way to the spa where we had a couples massage and then the mudslide treatment. This was our first spa experience so we don't have anything else to compare this to but we when it was over we were extremely relaxed and refreshed. Overall we were extremely satisfied with Solage. It is pricey but we were able to get a bit of a deal due to it being off season. However, I would have no reservation staying at Solage during the summer as that is where this resort would really shine. It isn't quite the same in the winter time. If they could improve anything I'd say they should have some kind of additional services for guests with dogs. It's a great place to bring your dog but they don't have any activities. If they had some kind of doggy daycare or other place you could leave your dog while you ate or went to the spa that would be great. I also wasn't happy with the alarm clock in the room, it wasn't up to par with the rest of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: trvlluver
Reviews.Content: It was quite last minute but we joined friends who were staying there for drinks and we were able to get a last-remaining suite at the last minute. Let me tell you, I was extremely impressed. Each room is it's own cottage. Even though two cottages are together, it is their living rooms (for the suites anyway) that butt up against the other. The outdoor jacuzzi was very private and also out of eyesight of any neighbors. The bikes at each cottage was such in interesting touch! The staff is happy to have you use them either on the grounds or to take them off on your own adventure. Each room was very nicely appointed in a very contemporary, simple yet complete way. We were surprised at just how well they had used the space. Bathrooms were huge, indoor sauna. The staff was fabulous! All very kind and friendly. No request too huge and they were always willing to do whatever it took to satisfy the customer. My advice, make sure to stay at least 2 days so that you can really experience the relaxation intended. This is not an overnighter place. I know that some have given less than glowing reviews but I don't know what that's about. They've been open for six months and may have been working through some issues. Our friends did have a slight mix up but the hotel went above and beyond in trying to correct the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JohnpdPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Our family is currently enjoying a 5 day getaway at this resort. We felt compelled to write a review because of previous comments. Clearly they do not appreciate the environmental efforts made by this resort, one of which is sustainable landscaping! We were pleasantly surprised after only being opened 4 months with not only the amount of landscaping but the variety as well. The attention to detail cannot be matched. The spa, the gym, the free exercise classes and the complimentary bikes at our room are incredible. Not to mention the Solbar restaurant which is among the best resort restaurants we have experienced. We have yet to encounter a member of the staff or management that has not been extremely helpful and friendly. Our past experiences in traveling have been with Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton. I would choose this resort over them any day.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and New!”
Reviews.Author: AppleGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Solage on Halloween and contrary to some reviews posted here it wasn't scary at all. I was warmly greeted by name upon check-in and given all of the information needed to ensure I would enjoy all of the resort amenities. Unfortunately, I didn't have a chance to dine at Solbar for dinner, but the Front Desk agent politely offered to make a reservation for me if I didn't already have plans. Bellmen escort you to your room on bikes and gave me a full tour of the room. I liked the fact the resort was brand new...everything was clean and sparkling. The decor isn't Motel 6, it's a simple aesthetic that fits in with and enhances the surrounding environment. To me, Solage seemed a good value for the price and I was really happy with my stay. Next time I will be sure to try a spa treatment and will definitely bring my workout clothes.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: sjwtravel
Reviews.Content: I was at Solage with ten friends for a 50th birthday weekend. We had a fabulous time. It was the perfect place to spend time with family and friends. The location is fantastic, just a ten minute walk into Calistoga. The rooms are great, very eco friendly and comfortable. I would have like a bathtub but it was not really that important. You can upgrade to a room with a tub if you want. We didn't stay in a suite but I did see one and it was very spacious and really nice. Many of my group wanted to buy the beds and pillows, they were that wonderful. The restaurant was lovely and the food was fantastic. We had breakfast there daily and on Saturday night had a birthday dinner outside on the patio facing the fire place and the pool. What a glorious setting! Everyone had spa treatments and although we all had different therapists everyone was happy with their services. The resort is relatively new but in all honestly the staff is very attentive and friendly and there was really not much to complain about. We had a great time and I will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor...Do Not Stay At Solage”
Reviews.Author: NYCtoCA
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with every comment that posted about this hotel. This had to be one of the worst experiences in the hotel industry. I travel all over the world and stay at Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton and thought by the advertisements that I would receive that level of service and ambiance. Well....if you are looking for service they have a long way to go....Just opening is no excuse as I have stayed at numerous Ritz-Carltons after opening and the service was top notch. Motel 6 does a better job than this place. No one seems to have a clue as to what they are doing. The management I think is more clueless than the line staff. The restaurant was horrible. It was the most bland menu I have ever experienced. No flavor.....just because you are green doesn't mean it has to taste bad! The rooms.....hmmmm where do you want me to begin....the concrete floors are freezing, the minimalistic decor is going to be dated in a year or so, the bathroom with no light privacy HUGE Issue...the patio that looks at everything in the resort and the poorly landscaped grounds....It looks like CAMP. My friends said it right when they said it reminded them of a Methodist retreat. Not to mention the event space that is right by all the rooms...Could you imagine if they were having an event? The entire resort would hear everything. They have this big white barn thing and if there was an event in there unless you rented out the entire grounds......you would be miserable if you wanted to go there to relax....It is just a joke. I would NEVER go back.....You have to wonder about the management....Oh...one last thing...there follow through is the pits. There famous answer is let us give you a call....the phone never rang unless it was someone from their staff dialing the wrong room...again ANNOYING...all in all....I don't know how this place is going to make it! I would think once, twice three times before waisting a dollar at Solage Calistoga -5 Stars

Reviews.Title: “Look at the user photos before you decide”
Reviews.Author: TravellerLA/DC
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at the Solage within a few weeks after it opened. We've stayed in Napa/Sonoma in the past, and have high expectations. We love hotels with a contemporary feel, and, looking at the Solage website and talking with the staff, we thought it would be great. Shortly before the trip, a staff member contacted us, and talked up the grounds -- explaining how wonderful they were, and how we wouldn't ever leave the property once we got there. The hotel's photos seemed to show a nicely-landscaped lux property. When we arrived, however, the property looked like a sad army barracks in the dust bowl. Almost none of the landscaping was in, construction was on-going, and it seemed like a full third of the rooms faced the parking lots. That said, the room was nicely decorated, but the rooms' windows and outdoor patios really are on top of one another - all facing each other across a square. No privacy at all. Because of that, the outdoor patio really isn't useful, and the rooms themselves are fairly small. We decided to leave. You can find much much nicer places to stay in Napa or Sonoma even at $450 per night. The initial clerk at the reception was fairly snotty about it -- and for this I nearly took his head off. The manager was very nice about refunding the room rate. I do think the property has the potential to be nice if they put in some bushes or something to give the rooms some privacy. What really ticked me off, however, was the way the staff had essentially flat-out lied about the state of the grounds before our arrival. If we hadn't been able to get a last-minute reservation ourselves somewhere else, I would honestly have contemplated a small claims suit for deception. Good luck to Solage -- and I hope they fire the guy who raved to us about the grounds over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great option--hip, relaxing and progressive!”
Reviews.Author: Nolanative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in New Orleans and decided to take a long vacation (by our standards) to Napa and Sonoma. We chose Calistoga BECAUSE of the fact that it was a fresh new resort with a unique style and green attitude. We were not disappointed! If you are one to avoid dusty floral bed and breakfasts with lace doilies and antique dolls, this would be your place! We LOVED the unique conceptual architecture and the design of the rooms and buildings as well as the resort itself. It must just be a matter of taste. We really enjoyed the serene-dessert-like surroundings as well as the use of the sanded concrete for the floors, low dividing wall to bathroom, etc. The place was impeccably clean, the beds were very soft and the bikes were great. Honestly, it seems that all of the complaints on here relate to either people not liking the style of the resort or the newness of it. The staff is young, but they were very friendly and helpful. The plants need to mature (I guess) but we thought that they actually added to the sparse spa-like atmosphere. In fact, the plants around the mineral pools and bathhouse were completely finished growing, including lemon trees! We are incredibly picky about food since we live in a major food city. Solbar was strong...we ate there for dinner one night, breakfast and then room service. The food was fresh, the portions were appropriately sized and the wine list was nice. Honestly, we were not expecting much as we do not typically expect hotel food to be some kind of five star dining experience. Thus, we were happy with our choices and enjoyed our meals. Ultimately, I would recommend this to travelers who have a hip and progressive aesthetic and those who appreciate a forward thinking hotel that places an importance on sustainable tourism. I would also strongly recommend the spa/bath house and the movement studio. The resort is in a great location and the price is certainly right especially when considering the other options in the area. Enjoy Solage now before it becomes as popular as Calistoga Ranch or L'Auberge. I am absolutely certain that when these kinks (immature landscaping, I guess...) that everyone speaks of are ironed out, Solage will be a much-appreciated respite for those seeking a comfortable and relaxing respite in Napa. We personally found it to already be one!

Reviews.Title: “bad”
Reviews.Author: solage
Reviews.Content: okay, the main problem is no privacy in your room. All the rooms face each other!!! The desighn is just plain stupid. Also, concrete floors in the room are soooooo cold! Also, the bathroom is just part of the room, so you can' t turn on the light if somebody else is sleeping. It faces a trailer park in the back - not very attractive! The only nice thing is the pool - which we did not use because it was raining, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, when we were there they were having an opening party for 500 people and did not let us know ahead of time - people were walking in front of our room for 4 hours! I would say - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Bellcanyongirl
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Solage and decided it was time to write my first Tripadvisor review considering how often I rely on other people's reviews. We (my sisters and mom) were there just one night and two days and I really appreciated that. Unlike the other Napa resorts, Solage was willing to do a one night booking. (I'm guessing that will change as soon as the place takes off.) I see that others rated the hotel negatively due to the fact that the landscaping hasn't grown in and construction is not completely finished. It took me awhile to figure out, but I think the whole point behind Solage (Sol as in "sun"-get it?) is to be sort of a pro-environment resort. Each room comes with 2 adorable bicycles so that instead of driving into town, you just take a 10 minute bike ride. There are solar panels on the main building; the showers have open doors and stone floors; and the landscape is sort of desert-like. Olive trees and grasses, etc. I really liked it, but if you don't appreciate that look, the place will not be for you. I happened to really like it.
